title: robin_(female)_(seaside_tactician)_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[robin (female) (fire emblem)|Female Robin]] from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]] when dressed in her summer attire from [[Fire_Emblem_Heroes]]' 2017 "Ylissean Summer":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Ylissean_Summer_(Focus)] banner. 

The Robin unit using this outfit is officially known as [i]Robin: Seaside Tactician[/i]

Can typically be identified thanks to the outfit's characteristics: a purple [[o-ring bikini]] with a large [[coat]] draped over it, a brown [[belt]], large brown [[boots]], a large [[net]] containing [[fish]], and a [[basket]] containing an [[octopus]].

Likely to include her weapon from the game, a large [[harpoon]] with a [[fish]] skewered on its points.

Note that it's possible (especially in older artwork) to depict Female Robin in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: constantia_s2
body:
A playable unit in [[Last Origin]].

She is a bioroid belonging to the Battle Maids Project series and is part of Squad 21. She is one of the first characters met by the [[Commander (last origin)|]].

Her weapon of choice is a custom [[Winchester Model 1866]] and she is often accompanied by her [[dog]], called [[Bori (last origin)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[green eyes]], and has [[large breasts]]. Her base skin consists of a [[maid]] outfit, featuring a prominent [[underboob cutout]], a short [[maid apron|apron]] and a [[miniskirt]]. She wears a [[pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. On her head she dons a [[maid headdress|headdress]] and a pair of [[round eyewear|round glasses]]. Her hair is styled in [[ponytail]] using a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]].

She was designed by [[kakiman]] and is voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]] in the Japanese version.

h4. Official art

* !post #3636370: Default
* !post #3636372: Battle suit
* !post #5582470: Night dress

h4. See also

* [[Bori (Last Origin)|]]

title: winchester_model_1894
body:
A [[lever-action]] repeating [[rifle]] designed in 1894 by John Browning. By far the most popular of the Winchester rifle family, the Model 1894 was the first commercially-available rifle to chamber cartridges using smokeless powder and is the best-selling high-powered rifle in US history, with more than 7 million units sold. Reproductions are still in production today.

As opposed to its predecessor, the [[winchester_model_1873|Model 1873]], the Model 1894 can be distinguished by its rounded receiver (the 1873 is more blocky) as well as being smaller in size by comparison. However, like the Model 1873, the Model 1894 features a grey-colored steel receiver, as opposed to the yellowish gunmetal seen on the [[winchester_model_1866|Model 1866]].

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia: "Winchester Model 1894":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winchester_Model_1894

In-game, it's clear that Female Robin is being possessed by [[Grima (Fire Emblem)|]] (as indicated by her having [[red eyes]] and [[purple fire]] floating around). If either of these elements are present in the image, Grima should also be tagged.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork) to depict Female Robin in a Halloween outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: winchester_model_1873
body:
The "Gun that Won the West", the .44 caliber Winchester Model 1873 was one of the most popular single firearms of the 19th Century, with over 700,000 sold by the time production ceased. The Model 1873 is distinguished from its predecessor, the [[winchester model 1866|Model 1866]], by its grey-colored steel receiver, and from its successor the [[winchester model 1894|Model 1894]] by it's size and the fact that its receiver is a squared shape, while the latter is smaller and more rounded.

title: winchester_model_1866
body:
The first in the long and hugely successful series of Winchester lever-action rifles, developed from the 1860 [[Henry rifle]].  The Winchester '66 can readily be distinguished from the Henry by the presence of a wooden forward stock, and by the King's Patent Loading Gate on the right side of the receiver. It can be distinguished from subsequent Winchester lever guns by the fact that its receiver is, like the Henry's, made from yellow gunmetal (a bronze/brass alloy) rather than steel.

title: tsukino_mito
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[Nijisanji]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Nezumidoshi]]. 

Her character is a 16-year-old, 2nd year high school student who is president of her class. As such, she often starts her videos with the phrase "Stand! Attention!" (きりーつ! 気をつけ!), and fans have responded by calling her "Chairman" (委員長 | iinchou). 

She often collaborates with her fellow classmates [[Higuchi Kaede]] (who shares the same illustrator) and [[Shizuka Rin]], under the name [[JK Gumi (Nijisanji)|JK-gumi]]. She reached one million subscribers on 12 December 2022, the fifth Nijisanji VTuber to reach this milestone.

She was one of Nijisanji's first eight VTubers revealed on Feb 7th, 2018. Since then, she has become the most prominent of the group and [i]de facto[/i] first character. Like the other Nijisanji personalities, her content focuses on livestreams and direct interaction with her audience.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and dark [[blue eyes]].

title: royce_and_royce_(umamusume)
body:
A character in the [i][[Umamusume (anime)|]][/i] anime who made her appearance in the third season, initially as a background character with only the last letter of her name visible, who happened to be part of Team Canopus. She would formally be introduced in Episode 12, just hours after her profile was released.

This dramaturge of a thoroughbred wants to cast herself in the role of "The Strongest".

Her obsession about that title is based around the fact that the original horse was (jokingly or not) given various variants of the title of "The Strongest X", where "X" meant "maiden horse", "single win horse" or "third place horse" at various times due to how often victory eluded the real [[Royce and Royce (racehorse)|]].

Voiced by [[Tanabe Rui]].

title: nijisanji
body:
[b]Nijisanji[/b] is a face-tracking app and [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] group, managed by Anycolor Inc. (formerly named Ichikara Inc.). The company began activities in early 2018, originally as an app developer with no intention of management (legend saying that at one time management had fewer people than their talent, before Mito exploded in popularity and necessitated more staff). The project was helmed by CEO [[Tazumi Riku]] and then-COO Iwanaga Taiki, the latter having since departed from the company.

While the app has no release date, and early on wasn't even approved by Apple, it is actively used by [i]Nijisanji Project[/i], a group of official [[virtual YouTuber|VTubers]]s referred to as "Virtual Livers".

Their characters are notably in 2D, instead of the initially more popular and established trend of 3D. This strategy was to minimize upfront investment and allow themselves a broader range of personalities. While some of the more popular characters do also have 3D models, 2D is still used for most appearances.

Many of the characters have alternate variations, such as [[official alternate costume|alternate costume]]s, [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyles]], accessories like [[kemonomimi mode|kemonomimi]], or even [[aged up]] forms. 

The official website offers a short profile for each character; however, the talent is given the freedom to develop their characters as they wish. As a result, few if any actually resemble their original profile. 

h4. Nijisanji Project members 

Initially grouping was done according to the time of debut and the nature of contract, but after 2019 these distinctions were removed and all members placed under [i]Nijisanji Project[/i]. This list represents their origins.

h5. Nijisanji

Debut: February 7, 2018

h6. First wave

* [[Tsukino Mito]]
* [[Shizuka Rin]]
* [[Higuchi Kaede]]
* [[Moira (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Elu (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Yuuki Chihiro]] (retired January 31, 2024)
* [[Suzuya Aki]] (retired August 31, 2024)
* [[Shibuya Hajime]]

h6. Second wave

Debut: Early March 2018

* [[Kenmochi Touya]]
* [[Fushimi Gaku]]
* [[Gilzaren III]]
* [[Fumino Tamaki]] (originally Noraneko)
* [[Ushimi Ichigo]]
* [[Yuuhi Riri]]
* [[Suzuka Utako]] (retired June 12, 2024)
* [[Mononobe Alice]]
* [[Ienaga Mugi]]
* [[Morinaka Kazaki]]

h5. Nijisanji Gamers 

First debut: May 2, 2018. A group specializing in [[video game]] [[livestream|streaming]], aiming to bridge the gap between the audiences for [[virtual YouTuber]]s and professional gaming. Membership included both professional and casual oriented gamers, however, and activities still involved traditional Liver content such as chatting streams and singing videos. While the group was treated as separate, there were no restrictions from interacting with members outside the group. Integrated into [i]Nijisanji Project[/i] as of 2019.

* [[Kanae (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Akabane Youko]]
* [[Sasaki Saku]]
* [[Yamiyono Moruru]] (retired June 27, 2019)
* [[Honma Himawari]]
* [[Makaino Ririmu]]
* [[Kuzuha (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Setsuna (Nijisanji)|]] (retired October 30, 2019)
* [[Shiina Yuika]]

h5. Nijisanji SEEDs

First debut: June 3, 2018. A group based on a "challenge framework with the potential for group activities." Its members were selected for variety, rather than experience or skill. While the group was treated as separate, there were no restrictions from interacting with members outside the group. Integrated into [i]Nijisanji Project[/i] as of 2019.

h6. First wave

* [[Dola (Nijisanji)|]]
* [[Umiyasha no Kami]] (retired April 9, 2019)
* [[Nakao Azuma]] (retired May 31, 2019)
* [[Izumo Kasumi (Nijisanji)|]] (retired October 31, 2020)
* [[Todoroki Kyouko]]
* [[Sister Claire]]
* [[Hanabatake Chaika]]
* [[Yashiro Kizuku]]
* [[Hassaku Yuzu]] (retired May 7, 2019)
* [[Azuchi Momo]] (retired January 31, 2024)
* [[Uzuki Kou]]
* [[Suzuki Masaru]]
* [[Ryuushen]]

h6. Second wave

First debut: August 9, 2018 

* [[Kanda Shouichi]]
* [[Amemori Sayo]]
* [[Naruto Kogane]] (retired December 31, 2018)
* [[Takamiya Rion]]
* [[Asuka Hina]]
* [[Maimoto Keisuke]]
* [[Rindou Mikoto]]
* [[Debidebi Debiru]]
* [[Sakura Ritsuki]]
* [[Machita Chima]]
* [[Tsukimi Shizuku]] (retired January 13, 2020)
* [[Joe Rikiichi]]
* [[Achikita Chinami]] (retired March 31, 2020)
* [[Belmond Banderas]]
* [[Yaguruma Rine]]
* [[Yumeoi Kakeru]]

h4. Nijisanji, China (二次三次, 彩虹社)

Nijisanji's Chinese branch. Most of these members focus their content on Chinese language platforms. 

h5. Nijisanji VTuber Project (二次三次虚拟主播企划) / [[VEgo]]

The original branch, auditions starting on July 17, 2018, and starting from August 24, 2018. It consisted of two parts, one based in Shanghai and the other in Taipei. By the end of March 2019, Nijisanji Shanghai had been deprecated, and on March 29, the branches stopped using the name 'Nijisanji', collectively changing their name to VEgo. VEgo later went inactive on March 31, 2020. Member list found on the branch's Wiki page.

h5. [[VirtuaReal]]

The current Chinese branch, established in collaboration with Bilibili, with auditions starting April 19, 2019, officially starting beginning from May 14, 2019. Member list found on the branch's Wiki page.

h4. Sister projects

* [[Yumenographia]] - service from the same company

* [[AniMare]] and [[Honey Strap]] - sister projects co-founded by (but not controlled by) Anycolor

* Nijisanji NetWORK - a partnership program aimed at supporting virtual talent; lasted from May 10 to December 31, 2019, only members were [[Tenkai Tsukasa]] and [[Fairys (vtuber)|]]

* [[Virtual Talent Academy]] - Anycolor's VTuber Trainee Program, announced on June 18, 2021, and soft-debuted November 1; has so far produced [[Ranunculus (nijisanji)|]], [[VOLTACTION]], [[Idios]], Usami Rito and Saiki Ittetsu (members of Oriens), Koyanagi Rou and Hoshirube Sho (members of Dytica), [[Mitarashi-dan]], Kitami Yusei and Sakaki Ness (members of 3SKM), Shiga Riko, Kisara, and Kozue Mone (members of Ayakaki)

title: star_trek:_lower_decks
body:
A 2020-2024 animated comedy [[Star Trek]] spin-off.  The series follows the events revolving around 4 junior officers aboard the USS Cerritos, a California-class starship whose primary missions were more focused on more mundane Federation tasks.

The series is named and inspired after [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]'s episode "Lower Decks" that also followed the events of several junior officers.

title: feather_(magia_record)
body:
A Feather is a low- or mid-ranking member of either Wings of Magius, Neomagius or Chargius within the [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]] universe.

They are characterized by a uniform featuring a hooded garment with a print of a given organization's symbol and a [[pendant]] shaped like [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]].
 
Within Wings of Magius, that uniform consists of a [[black cloak|black]] or [[white cloak|white]] [[cloak]] with a [[hooded cloak|hood]] featuring a print of a moth's eyes and antennae.

Chargius uses the same design as Wings of Magius, except the cloak is [[yellow cloak|yellow]].

Neomagius further divides the outfits depending on their ranks:
* A Black Feather's uniform consists of a [[hood]] with a print of [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]], the aforementioned pendant, a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[turtleneck dress|turtleneck]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[tabard]] and [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[pantyhose]].
* A White Feather's uniform consists of a [[hood]] with a print of [[Shitori Egumo (madoka magica)|]], the aforementioned pendant, a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[frilled sleeves]], a pair of [[bracelet]]s, [[white gloves]], a [[tabard]], [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[pantyhose]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]].

h4. External links
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Wings of the Magius":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Wings_of_the_Magius]
* "Puella Magi Wiki - Neomagius":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Neo-Magius]

title: undersuit
body:
When a character is not wearing multiple outer garments that who normally wears, and exposing the inner clothing that is not normally exposed (or partially exposed), but it is not [[underwear only]].
Or the [[undershirt]], [[bodysuit under clothes]], etc. are almost completely exposed with no outer clothes worn.
If the character is simply not wearing one of the outer garments (like [[jacket]], [[cape]], etc), please mainly use no_xx ([[no jacket]], [[no cape]], etc), unless the outer garment usually covers a large area of the inner clothing.

h4. See also

title: alina_gray
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]] and one of the three leaders of the Wings of Magius. Her [[Doppel (madoka magica)|]] form is [[Old Dorothy]]/[[Neo Dorothy Motherfucker]]. Often seen with her kouhai [[Misono Karin]].

She has [[aqua eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[green hair]] with a yellow [[streaked hair|streak]], [[sidelocks]], [[blunt ends]] and a [[hair between eyes|lock between her eyes]].

In her daily life she wears the [[Sakae General School uniform]], accessorized with a [[loose bowtie]], [[sleeves rolled up]], [[red wristband|red]] [[wristband]]s, a [[side-tie shirt]], a [[belt pouch]] with a [[paint stains|paint-stained]] [[cleaning rag]] and [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks|white]] [[socks]]. Her hair is also tied into a [[single hair ring|ring]].

As a [[Magical Girl]] she wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a [[green gemstone]], a [[white collar|white]] [[detached collar]], a [[black necktie|black]] [[cross tie]] with a green [[brooch]], a [[black vest|black]] [[v-neck]] [[vest]] with [[notched lapels]]; [[see-through sleeves|translucent]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[puffy short sleeves]] with [[sleeve cuffs|cuffs]], [[fur cuffs]], a [[black bow|black]] [[waist bow]] with a [[chain]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[multicolored skirt|multicolored]] [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-striped]] [[miniskirt]], [[garter straps]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[fur trim|fur-trimmed]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet]] [[fur-trimmed thighhighs|thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots]].

She is voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

title: falin_touden
body:
[[Dungeon Meshi]] character.

A [[falin touden (tallman)|tallman]] spellcaster, [[Laios Touden]]'s younger sister and [[Marcille Donato]]'s classmate. Her rescue is the main goal of the party. She saved the party from total defeat at the jaws of a red [[dragon]] by teleporting them away, but was eaten herself. [spoilers]The party killed the dragon and resurrected her, but she was turned into [[falin touden (chimera)|a chimera]] by the [[thistle (dungeon meshi)|mad sorcerer]].[/spoilers]

Like her brother, she has [[brown eyes]] (although they are often [[closed eyes|closed]]) and [[grey hair|platinum]]-[[blonde hair|blonde]] hair. Her adventuring garb includes a [[blue headwear|blue hat]] and [[blue robe|blue]]-and-[[white robe]], and she wields a [[mace]] that resembles a street light.

h4. External links

title: animal_collar
body:
A [[collar]] worn by a person (or animal), but specifically after or as a pet collar, typically a dog collar. It's usually a [[belt collar]], often with a [[buckle]]. The shape is usually on the thicker side and often sits looser around the neck, sometimes with a [[leash]], [[name tag]], [[neck bell]] or other animal-themed [[pendant]] attached, like a [[paw print]]. Most animal collars can also be tagged with another type of [[collar]], but add-ons like these, or the context give reason to add animal collar as well. 

Often worn by characters with [[animal ears]]. Sometimes associated with [[BDSM]] or [[pet play]].

H4. Examples
* !post #6602001: animal collar + [[neck bell]]  
* !post #6073365: with a [[leash]]
* !post #2394286: on an animal

title: orie_mishiro
body:
織衛 御白 (おりえ みしろ)

Mishiro is a character originally designed for [[Pixiv Fantasia Fallen Kings]] by [[konshin]].

She is a white fox girl with [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] with the tips [[gradient_hair|fading to blue]], [[blue eyes]] along with (obviously) drooping [[fox ears]] and a fluffy [[fox tail]].

She has the ability to turn into a [[fox]] and into a [[sword]]. She is the wife (and main weapon) of [[Orie Jinku]]. With him, she produced four children: [[orie_hakua|Hakua]], [[orie_kureha|Kureha]], [[orie_mitsugi|Mitsugi]], and [[orie_mihane|Mihane]].

title: nintendo_land
body: A 2012 party video game developed by [[Nintendo]] for the [[Wii U]] console. It serves as a “virtual theme park,” featuring 12 different mini-games (referred to as attractions), each inspired by popular Nintendo franchises like [[Mario (series)|Super Mario]], [[The Legend of Zelda]], [[Metroid]], [[Pikmin (series)|Pikmin]], and others.

title: elegg_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of the [[Electric Shock (nikke)|]] squad with [[Trony (nikke)|]].

She specializes in electronics. Her goal is to [[it_runs_doom_(meme)|install her favorite FPS video game BOOM on every device with a screen]].

Her characterization is a homage to the [[Doom (series)|]] franchise. Her [[boomstick (nikke)|weapon]] is based on the [[BFG 9000]] from the 2005 movie, [[Doom (2005 movie)|]]. The cover art for the character from BOOM is a homage to the cover art of [[Doom (2016)]]. Elegg's obsession of installing BOOM to every device is a reference to how people can play the original 1993 Doom on certain devices such as a [[calculator]].

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[blonde hair]] which [[hair over eyes|covers]] her [[purple eyes]] along with [[huge breasts]] and [[plump]] body. Her outfit consists of a [[crop top]] with [[black sports bra]], [[suspenders]], [[thigh strap]], and a [[short shorts]] with a [[bag]] on her left side.

Illustrator: [[jam (nandade)|Jamjamjam1620]]

h4. Official art

* !post #7236836: Default

title: mauser_98
body:
A series of [[bolt action]] [[rifle]]s designed and manufactured by Mauser, chambered for 7.92×57mm and utilizing a 5-round internal magazine. The Mauser 98 is recognizable by its two handguard metal bands on the front (one serves for sling swivels), ability to store a [[cleaning rod]] inside the lower handguard, and semi-grip buttstock.

This tag includes any variants, such as:

* [b]Gewehr 98[/b], introduced in 1898. The original model that served the German military during [[World War I]]. Has a straight bolt handle.
* [b]Karabiner 98k[/b], introduced in 1935. Essentially the shortened Gewehr 98 of it with a bent bolt. Used by the Germans during [[World War II]]. Generally known as "Kar 98" (with or without space) for short.
* Other foreign-produced copies such as the Polish Wz.29 and Chinese "Type 24":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiang_Kai-shek_rifle].

h4. See also

* [[Gewehr 41]]
* [[Kar98k (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gewehr 98":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gewehr_98
* "Wikipedia: Karabiner 98 kurz":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karabiner_98k

title: spread_pussy_from_compression
body:
The [[pussy]] is spread open due to external compression, such as from pressing against an object or surface, without the use of hands or sexual actions like [[gaping]]. This tag focuses on the visible effect of deformation caused by pressure.

title: chuckya
body:
An enemy introduced in [[Super Mario 64]]. If they grab you, they'll chuck you away. 

Their body is that of a purple sphere and they have red spheres for hands as well as a red sphere on top of an antennae above their head. [[Super Mario 64 DS]] gives them a yellow wind up key in the back.

Despite being related to the [[Bob-Omb]]s, it does not have a fuse or explode in a way a bomb would.

title: api:bulk_update_requests
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
** 4.05 "Delete":#dtext-delete
** 4.06 "Approve":#dtext-approve
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the upload records through the API.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] Only upload records created by oneself are visible, unless you are an Admin ([[Help:Users]]).[/tn]

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]

[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]user_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]script[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][code][pending, approved, rejected, processing, failed][/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]user[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "bulk_update_requests"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "bulk_update_request"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with bulk update request records.

[hr]

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_requests.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. Search attributes

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b][[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b][[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]][/b]
** [code]script[/code]
* [b][[help:user_syntax|User syntax]][/b]
** [code]user[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [b][[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]][/b]
** [code]forum_topic[/code]
** [code]forum_post[/code]
** [code]tags[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. Special search parameters

* [code]status[/code] - The status of the bulk update request (separated by commas).

[hr]

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_requests/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h5#Create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Mandatory[/b]:
** [code]script[/code]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]reason[/code]
** [code]forum_topic_id[/code]

[b]Note:[/b]If forum topic ID is present, then title will be ignored. If forum topic ID is absent, then title will be used to create a new forum topic. The reason will be used to create a new forum post.

[hr]

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#update-parameters. Update parameters

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]script[/code]

* [b]Admin-only parameters[/b]:
** [code]forum_post_id[/code]
** [code]forum_topic_id[/code]

[hr]

h5#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] Only the user that created the bulk update request or an Admin may delete it.

[hr]

h5#approve. Approve

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id/approve.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] Builders and above can approve bulk update requests that:

[quote]
* Rename or alias
* Only artist tags
* Post count must be less than 200
[/quote]

Otherwise, only an admin may approve that request.
[hr]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/bulk_update_requests_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/bulk_update_request.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/bulk_update_request_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: against_transparent_object
body:
Pressing against a transparent object, such as plastic, glass, or other see-through materials, causing visible deformation.

h4. See also

[[ass press]]
[[ass on glass]]

title: ass_on_innertube
body: Ass visibly pressed against innertube.

title: iterator_(rain_world)
body:
In the game [[Rain World]], Iterators are sapient artificial intelligences running on semi-biological supercomputers of colossal scale (large enough to build cities on top of). Most often an Iterator is depicted through its "puppet": a [[humanoid robot]] connected to the hardware via an umbilical cable. Each Iterator's puppet has a characteristic design which includes [[colored skin|skin color]], a unique [[forehead mark]]. and various styles of [[robot ears]].

Two Iterators can be met in the course of regular gameplay:
* [[Looks to the Moon]]
* [[Five Pebbles]]

An additional three Iterators cannot be met, but have a canonical appearance and play a major role in the events and lore of the game.
* [[No Significant Harassment]]
* [[Seven Red Suns]]
* [[Sliver of Straw]]

Consistently, Moon and Straw take female pronouns (and Moon self-identifies as "Big Sis Moon"), Five Pebbles and NSH take male pronouns, while Seven Red Suns takes singular neuter "they".

title: shishiro_botan_(button-down)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costime]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

This costume has 2 different variations for the top:
* A [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], with a red [[bolo tie]] and either a [[black vest|black]] [[waistcoat]] or an [[underbust]] [[chest harness]]
* A [[black sports bra]] and [[dog tags]]

Both versions share the same bottom consisting of a pair of [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with [[legwear garter]]s/[[thigh strap]]s, [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[ankle boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair flaps]] and [[sidelocks]]
* [[Short hair|Short]] grey [[streaked hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #4748734: Reference sheet
* !post #5218463: Profile (with [[sheep hood]])
* !post #5838040: Merchandise
* !post #4817130: L2D
other_names: 獅白ぼたん(シャツ衣装)

title: shishiro_botan_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

It consists of a [[crop top|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[skin tight]] [[black shirt]] with a [[see-through cleavage]] section, a [[necklace]] a [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[zipper skirt]] [[miniskirt]], [[torn pantyhose|torn]] [[black pantyhose|black]] [[single leg pantyhose]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4035602: Profile
* !post #5838096: Reference sheet
* !post #4049660: L2D

title: cereza
body: [[Bayonetta]]'s [[aged down|younger]] self.

title: bayonetta
body:
The main character of the action game series [[bayonetta (series)|Bayonetta]]. She uses pistols and magical attacks to defeat enemies.

The guns attached to her [[high heels]] are [[ankle gun]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Cereza]]

title: bayonetta_(series)
body:
Bayonetta is a series of action games centered on its eponymous character, [[Bayonetta]], who uses pistols and magical attacks to defeat enemies.

h4. Games

* [[Bayonetta 1]]
* [[Bayonetta 2]]
* [[Bayonetta 3]]
* [[Bayonetta Origins: Cereza and the Lost Demon]]

title: api:users
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 1. "Bit fields":#dtext-bit-fields
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the user records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]level[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][10, 20, 30, 31, 32, 40, 50][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]inviter_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_update_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]note_update_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_upload_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]favorite_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]unread_dmail_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]bit_prefs[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]Each bit stores a boolean value. See "Bit fields":[#dtext-bit-fields] below for more information.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]theme[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][light, dark][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]favorite_tags[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]blacklisted_tags[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]comment_threshold[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]timezone[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]per_page[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]1 - 200[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]default_image_size[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][large, original][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]custom_css[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]upload_points[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_forum_read_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_logged_in_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#bit-fields. Bit fields

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Bit position[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]status[/td]
[td]0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]receive_email_notifications[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]2[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]always_resize_images[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]3[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]

[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]7[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]setting[/td]
[td]8[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]style_usernames[/code][/td]

[td]9[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_auto_complete[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]10[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]show_deleted_children[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]11[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_categorized_saved_searches[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]15[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_tagged_filenames[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]17[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_cropped_thumbnails[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]19[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_mobile_gestures[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]20[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_safe_mode[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]21[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_desktop_mode[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]22[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]disable_post_tooltips[/code][/td]
[td]setting[/td]
[td]23[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]enable_recommended_posts[/code][/td]

[td]24[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]requires_verification[/code][/td]
[td]status[/td]
[td]28[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_verified[/code][/td]
[td]status[/td]
[td]29[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]inviter[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "users"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "user"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with user records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is created at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]level[/code]
** [code]post_upload_count[/code]
** [code]post_update_count[/code]
** [code]note_update_count[/code]
** [code]favorite_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]inviter[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the name field.
* [code]min_level[/code] - Minimum user level to include.
* [code]max_level[/code] - Maximum user level to include.
* [code]current_user_first[/code] - Shows the current user first, then all other users by ID desc.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical on the name field.
** [code]post_upload_count[/code]
** [code]post_update_count[/code]
** [code]note_count[/code]

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the user ID.
Can also be reached by using the [code]/profile[/code] endpoint for the current user.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]password[/code]
** [code]password_confirmation[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]email[/code]

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/users/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the user ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]comment_threshold[/code]
** [code]default_image_size[/code]
** [code]favorite_tags[/code]
** [code]blacklisted_tags[/code]
** [code]time_zone[/code]
** [code]per_page[/code]
** [code]custom_style[/code]
** [code]theme[/code]
** [code]receive_email_notifications[/code]
** [code]always_resize_images[/code]
** [code]enable_post_navigation[/code]
** [code]new_post_navigation_layout[/code]
** [code]enable_private_favorites[/code]
** [code]enable_sequential_post_navigation[/code]
** [code]show_deleted_posts[/code]
** [code]style_usernames[/code]
** [code]enable_auto_complete[/code]
** [code]show_deleted_children[/code]
** [code]disable_categorized_saved_searches[/code]
** [code]disable_tagged_filenames[/code]
** [code]disable_cropped_thumbnails[/code]
** [code]disable_mobile_gestures[/code]
** [code]enable_safe_mode[/code]
** [code]enable_desktop_mode[/code]
** [code]disable_post_tooltips[/code]
* [b]Admin only:[/b]
** [code]level[/code]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]

title: api:uploads
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the upload records through the API.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] Only upload records created by oneself are visible, unless you are an Admin ([[Help:Users]]).[/tn]

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]source[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]referer_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]media_asset_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]error[/code][/td]
[td]string or null[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]upload_media_assets[/code][/td]
[td]upload media asset[/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]media_assets[/code][/td]
[td]media asset[/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]posts[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "uploads"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "upload"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with upload records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]media_asset_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]status[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]referer_url[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]post[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]uploader[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]media_assets[/code]
** [code]upload_media_assets[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]is_posted[/code] - Whether to show uploads that have a post or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the upload ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h5#Create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Mandatory[/b]: One of these values must be present.
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]files[/code] ([tn]"array file format":[/wiki_pages/help:hash_syntax#dtext-array-of-files])[/tn]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]referer_url[/code]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/uploads_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/upload.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/upload_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the tag alias records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td]includes [active, deleted, retired][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]reason[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td]unused[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the alias.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]User that approved the alias.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Forum topic where the aliasas discussed.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Forum post which started the alias discussion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Tag of the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Tag of the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_wiki[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page of the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_wiki[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page of the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "tag_aliases"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "tag_alias"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_aliases.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]antecedent_name[/code]
** [code]consequent_name[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
* [code]forum_topic[/code]
* [code]forum_post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the antecedent name or consequent name fields.
* [code]status[/code] - Case-insensitive search on the status field.
* [code]category[/code] - Searches on the category of the consequent tag, with support for multiple categories being space-delimited.

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by created_at descending.
* [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by updated_at descending.
* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]tag_count[/code] - Orders by post count of the consequent tag, then alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]custom[/code] - See "here":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order] for more info.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_aliases/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_aliases/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.
Restricted to Admin+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/tag_aliases_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag_relationship.rb>
<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag_alias.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/tag_alias_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table

[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]reason[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]enum[/td]
[td]See "Status table":[#dtext-status] for list of acceptable values.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]

[td]>0, limited to Moderator+ or the flag creator[/td]

[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]

[td][/td]

[th]Value[/th]
[th]Enum[/th]

[td]0[/td]
[td]pending[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]1[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]2[/td]

[th]Details[/th]

[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Post that the flag belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "post flags"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "post flag"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/post_flags.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]post_id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]reason[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_resolved[/code]
* [[help:enum_syntax|Enum syntax]]
** [code]status[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]status[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]reason_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the reason field.
* [code]creator_id[/code] - Searches for flags by creator ID. Single ID only.
* [code]creator_name[/code] - Searches for flags by creator name. Single name only.
* [code]category_matches[/code] - Can be: normal, unapproved, rejected, deleted.

h5. Search order

The search order can only be changed with the "custom parameter":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order].

title: api:forum_topics
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create":#dtext-create
* 07. "Update":#dtext-update
* 08. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 09. "Undelete":#dtext-undelete
* 10. "Mark all as read":#dtext-mark-all-as-read
* 11. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 12. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the forum topic records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][0,1,2][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]response_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]min_level[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]Corresponds to the level of user ([[API:Users]]).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_sticky[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_locked[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#category-id. Category ID

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Value[/th]
[th]Description[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]0[/td]
[td]General[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]1[/td]
[td]Tags[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]2[/td]
[td]Bugs & features[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that last updated the forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]The first forum post of a forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#Nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "forum_topics"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "forum_topic"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]category_id[/code]
** [code]response_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]title[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]forum_posts[/code]
** [code]bulk_update_requests[/code]
** [code]tag_aliases[/code]
** [code]tag_implications[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the title text field.
* [code]status[/code] - The status of an attached [[api:bulk_update_requests|BUR]]. Can be: pending, approved, rejected.
* [code]is_private[/code] - Shows topics that have a min level set or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).
* [code]is_read[/code] - Shows topics that have been read by the user or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).
* [code]is_deleted[/code] - Unless this value is present, [u]deleted forum_topics are hidden[/u].

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]sticky[/code] - Shows sticky topics first, sorted by updated at second.
* [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

The order can also be changed to ID descending by using "sequential pagination":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-sequential].

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create parameters]]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]category_id[/code] - Can be: 0, 1, 2.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]original_post_attributes[body][/code] - DText that will be used to create a forum post entry at the same time.
*** Is a hash value, so the final parameter format is [code]forum_topic[original_post_attributes][body][/code]

h6.Restricted to Moderator+

* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]min_level[/code] - Can be: 0, 40, 50
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Update parameters]]

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create forum topic action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional. Besides those, it also accepts the following additional optional parameters.

* [code]original_post_attributes[id][/code] - The ID of the the first post on a topic.
** Is a hash value, so the final parameter format is [code]forum_topic[original_post_attributes][id][/code]
** This parameter [u]is required[/u] if the original post's body is being updated as well.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.
Restricted to Moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update forum topic action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.
Restricted to moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update forum topic action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#mark-all-as-read. Mark all as read

Marks every topic as being read.

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/mark_all_as_read.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/forum_topics_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/forum_topic.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/forum_topic_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:dmails
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record

** 4.05 "Mark all as read":#dtext-mark-all-as-read
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the dmail records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]owner_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]to_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]from_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_read[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_spam[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td]obsolete[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]key[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]owner[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]to[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]from[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "dmails"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "dmail"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with dmail records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.
Only Dmails to or from the user will be shown, regardless of user level.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]to[/code]
** [code]from[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_read[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the title fields.
* [code]message_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the body field.
* [code]folder_matches[/code]
** [b]received[/b] - Shows all dmails to the user.
** [b]unread[/b] - Shows all unread dmails to the user.
** [b]sent[/b] - Shows all dmails from the user.
** [b]deleted[/b] - Shows all dmails deleted by the user.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the dmail ID.
Normally only the owner can see the dmail, unless the correct dmail key is also supplied.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#show-parameters. Show parameters.

* [code]key[/code] Unique key for every dmail that will allow anyone to view the dmail.

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]

title: api:comments

[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the comment records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]score[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_sticky[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]do_not_bump_post[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_ip_addr[/code][/td]
[td]inet[/td]
[td]Limited to Moderator+[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_ip_addr[/code][/td]
[td]inet[/td]
[td]Limited to Moderator+[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]

[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]

[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#Nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "comments"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "comment"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] [code]group_by[/code] as a parameter must be set to [code]comment[/code], or else posts will be returned instead (e.g. [code]group_by=comment[/code]).

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]score[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]do_not_bump_post[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]post[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]post_id[/code] - Orders by post ID.
** [code]score[/code] - Orders by comment score.
** [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by [b]updated_at[/b] timestamp.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the comment ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]post_id[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]do_not_bump_post[/code]

h6. Restricted to Moderator+

* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the comment ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]body[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h6. Restricted to Moderator+

* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the comment ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update comment action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/comments/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the comment ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update comment action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/comments_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/comment.rb>[/td]

[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/comment_policy.rb>[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]removed_tags[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]string, "tag format":[/wiki_pages/help:tags#dtext-restrictions][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]rating[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][g, s, q, e][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]parent_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]

[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]

[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]

[td][/td]

[td]>0[/td]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]post_id[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]updater_id[/code]
** [code]version[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]tags[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]rating_changed[/code]
** [code]parent_changed[/code]
** [code]source_changed[/code]
* [[help:array_syntax|Array syntax]]
** [code]added_tags[/code]
** [code]removed_tags[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]changed_tags[/code] - Search where all tags must be either an added tag or removed tag
** The list of tags is space-delineated
* [code]all_changed_tags[/code] - The same as [code]changed_tags[/code]
* [code]changed_tags[/code] - Search where at least one tag must be either an added tag or removed tag
** The list of tags is space-delineated
* [code]tag_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive search of the tag string with first tag from the input
** If asterisks ( * ) are missing from the input, it adds an asterisk to either side of the tag
* [code]updater_name[/code] - Searches by updater name instead of updater ID
