** [code]name[/code]
** [code]group_name[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_banned[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]updater[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical on the name field.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_versions/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist version ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/artists_versions_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/artist_version.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/artist_version_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:wiki_pages
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Derived field format":#dtext-record
* 03. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create":#dtext-create
* 07. "Update":#dtext-update
* 08. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 09. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 10. "See also":#dtext-see-also
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the wiki page records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]other_names[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]strings[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]locked[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#derived. Derived field format

These are values which are not part of the actual record, but instead are derived from calculations and record lookups on the fly.

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[th]Notes[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]category_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][0,1,3,4,5,null][/td]
[td]It is the [code]category[/code] of the "associated tag":[#dtext-associations] if it exists, otherwise it is null.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "wiki_pages"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "wiki_page"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Wiki page versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:array_syntax|Array syntax]]
** [code]other_names[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]tag[/code]
** [code]artist[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]title_normalize[/code] - Normalized case-insensitive wildcard searching on the title text field.
* [code]other_names_match[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on any of the other names.
* [code]linked_to[/code] - All wiki pages that link to the given wiki title.
* [code]not_linked_to[/code] - All wiki pages that do not link to the given wiki title.
* [code]hide_deleted[/code] - Hides all deleted wikis (boolean syntax).
** Shortcut for [code]search[is_deleted]=false[/code]
* [code]other_names_present[/code] - Shows wikis based on the presence of other names (boolean syntax).
** Shortcut for [code]search[other_name_count]=>0[/code] (TRUE) and [code]search[other_name_count]=0[/code] (FALSE)
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]title[/code] - Alphabetical order on the title.
** [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]title[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]body[/code]
** [code]other_names[/code] - Uses URL array parameter format.
** [code]other_names_string[/code] - Space delimited list of post IDs.
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create wiki page action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update wiki page action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The wiki page version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/wiki_pages_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/wiki_page.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/wiki_page_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:posts
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
** 4.05 "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the post records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_general[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_artist[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_copyright[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_string_character[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr][tr]
[td][code]tag_string_meta[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]rating[/code][/td]
[td]string or null[/td]
[td]includes [g, s, q, e][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]parent_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer or null[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]source[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]md5[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]file_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]large_file_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]preview_file_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]file_ext[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]file_size[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]image_width[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]score[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]fav_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_general[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_artist[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_copyright[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_character[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_count_meta[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_comment_bumped_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp or null[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]last_noted_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp or null[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]has_children[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]image_height[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]parent[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]children[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist_commentary[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artist_commentaries|artist_commentary]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]notes[/code][/td]
[td][[api:notes|note]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]comments[/code][/td]
[td][[api:comments|comment]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]flags[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_flags|post flag]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]appeals[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_appeals|post appeals]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approvals[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_approvals|post approval]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]replacements[/code][/td]
[td][[api:post_replacement|post replacement]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]pixiv_ugoira_frame_data[/code][/td]
[td][[api:pixiv_ugoira_frame_data|Pixiv ugoira frame data]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "posts"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "post"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Post versions]]

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with upload records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#index-parameters. Index parameters

* [code]tags[/code] - The post query to search for using tags and metatags ([[Help:Cheatsheet]]).
** [code]post[tags][/code] can also be used.
* [code]random[/code] - Selects a random sampling under the post query.
* [code]format[/code] - Chooses which format to return. Can be: html, json, xml, atom.
* [code]md5[/code] - Search for an MD5 match. Takes priority over all other parameters.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the post ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td]/posts.json[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Mandatory[/b]:
** [code]upload_media_asset_id[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]tag_string[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]artist_commentary_title[/code]
** [code]artist_commentary_desc[/code]
** [code]translated_commentary_title[/code]
** [code]translated_commentary_desc[/code]
** [code]is_pending[/code] - only matters for users with unrestricted uploads.

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]$id is the post ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]tag_string[/code]
** [code]old_tag_string[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]old_parent_id[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]old_source[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]old_rating[/code]
** [code]has_embedded_notes[/code]

h5#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]

[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. Search attributes

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]x[/code]
** [code]y[/code]
** [code]width[/code]
** [code]height[/code]
** [code]version[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_active[/code]
* [b]"Post syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:post_syntax][/b]
** [code]post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. Special search parameters

[table]
[tbody]

[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]

[b]Note:[/b] This does a redirect to the post with that note when using the HTML interface, specifically highlighting that note when it gets there.

** [code]y[/code] - y coordinate of the note starting from the top of the image.

* [b]Optional[/b]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the pool records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_ids[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]integers > 0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][series, collection][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_active[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td]unused[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

None.

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "pools"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "pool"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Pool versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]description[/code]
* [b]"Array syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:array_syntax][/b]
** [code]post_ids[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Normalized case-insensitive wildcard searching on the name text field.
* [code]description_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the description text field.
* [code]post_tags_match[/code] - The pools's post's tags match the given terms. Meta-tags not supported.
* [code]category[/code]
** [code]series[/code] - Only series-type pools.
** [code]collection[/code] - Only collection-type pools.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of the results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetic order by name.
** [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by creation time.
** [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]category[/code] - Can be: series, collection.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]description[/code]
** [code]post_ids[/code] - Uses URL array parameter format.
** [code]post_ids_string[/code] - Space delimited list of post IDs.
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create pool action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update pool action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update pool action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The pool version ID to revert to.

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]any_other_name_like[/code] - Search for artists that have an other name matching this value. Supports wildcards.
* [code]any_name_matches [/code] - Search for artists that have a matching name, group name, or other name. Supports wildcards and regexes.
* [code]url_matches[/code] - Search for artists with a matching URL.
** Does a regex match when the query starts and ends with a forward slash "/".
*** Regexes must follow the Ruby's format.
** Does a wildcard match when there are asterisks "*" present.
** Uses the artist URL finder when the value is prefaced by [code]http://[/code] or [code]https://[/code]
*** This does a recursive search on URLs stripping the pathname one level at a time to search for matches.
*** It will keep searching until it finds an exact match or 10 similar entries.
** Otherwise it does a wildcard search with wildcard placed at the start and end.
* [code]any_name_or_url_matches[/code] - Searches for the artist by name or URL.
** Does a URL search if the value is prefaced by [code]http://[/code] or [code]https://[/code]
** Does a name search otherwise.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of the results.
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
** [code]post_count[/code]

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]- The artist tag name.
*** Must be tag format ([[API:tags]]).
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]group_name[/code] - The name of the group this artist belongs to.
** [code]other_names[/code] - List of alternative names for this artist.
*** Space delimited. Replace spaces within names with underscores.
** [code]url_string[/code] - List of URLs associated with this artist
*** Whitespace or newline delimited.
** [code]is_deleted[/code] - Set the artist entry as deleted or not.

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create artist action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] The action can be accomplished using the "update artist action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#banned. Banned

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/banned.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]Redirects to the "index artist action":[#dtext-index] with [code]is_banned[/code] set to [b]true[/b].[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The artist version ID to revert to.

h4#ban. Ban

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/ban.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.
Restricted to Admins only ([[Help:Users]])[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#ban. Unban

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/unban.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.
Restricted to Admins only ([[Help:Users]])[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/artists_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/artist.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/artist_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:forum_posts
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create":#dtext-create
* 07. "Update":#dtext-update
* 08. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 09. "Undelete":#dtext-undelete
* 10. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 11. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the forum post records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that last updated the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Forum topic the forum post is on.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Dtext links on the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]votes[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_post_votes|forum post vote]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Any votes the forum post may have.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag alias[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Tag aliases linked to the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag implication[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_implications|tag implication]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Tag implications linked to the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]bulk update request[/code][/td]
[td][[api:bulk_update_requests|bulk update request]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Bulk update requests linked to the forum post.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "forum_posts"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "forum_post"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]topic_id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]topic[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]
** [code]votes[/code]
** [code]tag alias[/code]
** [code]tag implication[/code]
** [code]bulk update request[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]topic_title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the topic title the forum post is on.
* [code]topic_category_id[/code] - Can be: 0, 1, 2 (General, Tags, Bugs & Features respectively).
* [code]linked_to[/code] - Shows forum posts that link to a particular wiki.
** The parameter must use the same format as the wiki title
** I.e. all lowercase and underscores instead of spaces

h5. Search order

The search order is not configurable with a search parameter. However, the order can still be changed to ID descending by using "sequential pagination":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-sequential].

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create parameters]]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]body[/code]
** [code]topic_id[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Update parameters]]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]body[/code]

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.
Restricted to Moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_posts/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.
Restricted to Moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/forum_posts_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/forum_post.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/forum_post_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:tags
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Update":#dtext-update
* 07. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 08. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the tag records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]includes [0,1,3,4,5][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>=0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deprecated[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#category. Category

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Value[/th]
[th]Description[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]0[/td]
[td]General[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]1[/td]
[td]Artist[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]3[/td]
[td]Copyright[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]4[/td]
[td]Character[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]5[/td]
[td]Meta[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]wiki_page[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page whose title matches the tag name.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Artist whose name matches the tag name.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_alias[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Alias where the tag is the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_aliases[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Aliases where the tag is the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_implications[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_implications|tag implication]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Implications where the tag is the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_implications[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_implications|tag implication]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Implications where the tag is the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Dtext links to the page whose title matches the tag name.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "tags"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "tag"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tags.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]category[/code]
** [code]post_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]name[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deprecated[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]wiki_page[/code]
** [code]artist[/code]
** [code]antecedent_alias[/code]
** [code]consequent_aliases[/code]
** [code]antecedent_implications[/code]
** [code]consequent_implications[/code]
** [code]consequent_implications[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]fuzzy_name_matches[/code] - Shows tags with names that are within a certain percentage of similarity.
* [code]name_matches[/code] - Normalized wildcard search on the name field.
* [code]name_normalize[/code] - Normalized wildcard search on the name field that supports multiple tags split by a comma ",".
* [code]name_or_alias_matches[/code] - Normalized wildcard search on the name field that also checks for aliases where the search term is the antecedent.
* [code]hide_empty[/code] - Shows only tags that have a post count greater than 0 ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the name.
* [code]date[/code] - Orders by ID descending.
* [code]count[/code] - Orders by post count.
* [code]similarity[/code] - Orders by similarity to the search term.
** Only when the [code]fuzzy_name_matches[/code] parameter is used.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tags/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the tag ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tags/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the tag ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Update parameters]]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]is_deprecated[/code]
*** can only be set to [code]false[/code] by admins
*** can only be set to [code]true[/code] if the tag has a wiki page, and either its post count is zero or the user is an admin
** [code]category[/code] Restricted by user level
*** Member+: < 50 posts
*** Builder+: < 1000 posts
*** Admin+: No limit

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/tags_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/tag_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:tag_implications
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Index":#dtext-index
* 5. "Show":#dtext-show
* 6. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 7. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 8. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the tag implication records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td]includes [active, deleted, retired][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]reason[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td]unused[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the implication.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]User that approved the implication.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Forum topic where the implication was discussed.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Forum post which started the implication discussion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Tag of the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Tag of the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_wiki[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page of the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_wiki[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page of the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "tag_implications"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "tag_implication"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_implications.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]antecedent_name[/code]
** [code]consequent_name[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
* [code]forum_topic[/code]
* [code]forum_post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the antecedent name or consequent name fields.
* [code]status[/code] - Case-insensitive search on the status field.
* [code]category[/code] - Searches on the category of the consequent tag, with support for multiple categories being space-delimited.
* [code]implied_from[/code] - List of tag implication ancestors of the antecedent tag.
* [code]implied_to[/code] - List of tag implication descendants of the consequent tag.

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by created_at descending.
* [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by updated_at descending.
* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]tag_count[/code] - Orders by post count of the consequent tag, then alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]custom[/code] - See "here":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order] for more info.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_implications/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/tag_implications/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum post ID.
Restricted to Admin+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/tag_implications_controller.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag_relationship.rb>
<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/tag_implication.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/tag_implication_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table

title: api:artist_commentaries
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create or update":#dtext-create-or-update
* 07. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 08. "See also":#dtext-see-also
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the artist commentary records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]translated_title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]translated_description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Post that the artist commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "artist_commentaries"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "artist_commentary"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Artist commentary versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]original_title[/code]
** [code]original_description[/code]
** [code]translated_title[/code]
** [code]translated_description[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]text_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on any of the text fields.
* [code]original_present[/code] (boolean syntax) - Does it have an original title or an original description?
* [code]translated_present[/code] (boolean syntax) - Does it have a translated title or a translated description?
* [code]is_deleted[/code] (yes or no) - Does it have all empty fields or not?

h5. Search order

The search order can only be changed with the "custom parameter":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order].

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries/$id.json[/code][br][code]/posts/$post_id/artist_commentary.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist commentary ID.[br][code]$post_id[/code] is ID of the post that the commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This does a redirect to the post with that commentary when using the HTML interface.

h3#create-or-update. Create or Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries/create_or_update.json[/code][br][code]/posts/$post_id/artist_commentary/create_or_update.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$post_id[/code] is ID of the post that the commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create/update parameters]]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]post_id[/code] - The post ID the commentary belongs to.
*** When using the [code]/posts/$post_id/[/code] version, the post ID is already set.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]original_title[/code]
** [code]original_description[/code]
** [code]translated_title[/code]
** [code]translated_description[/code]
** [code]add_commentary_tag[/code] - Add the [[commentary]] tag.
** [code]add_commentary_request_tag[/code] - Add the [[commentary_request]] tag.
** [code]add_commentary_check_tag[/code] - Add the [[commentary_check]] tag.
** [code]add_partial_commentary_tag[/code] - Add the [[partial_commentary]] tag.
** [code]remove_commentary_tag[/code] - Remove the [[commentary]] tag.
** [code]remove_commentary_request_tag[/code] - Remove the [[commentary_request]] tag.
** [code]remove_commentary_check_tag[/code] - Remove the [[commentary_check]] tag.
** [code]remove_partial_commentary_tag[/code] - Remove the [[partial_commentary]] tag.

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artist_commentaries/$id/revert.json[/code][br][code]/posts/$post_id/artist_commentary/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the post ID (not the artist commentary ID).[br][code]$post_id[/code] is ID of the post that the commentary belongs to.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The artist commentary version ID to revert to.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] The version ID may be passed along as a URL parameter instead of in the body.[/tn]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/artist_commentaries_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/artist_commentary.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/artist_commentary_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: fuwawa_abyssgard_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Fuwawa Abyssgard]].

It consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]] with [[long sleeves]] worn over a [[white dress|white]] [[short dress]] with a [[detached collar|detached]] [[frilled shirt collar|frilled]] [[bib collar]] with [[center frills]], a [[cleavage cutout]] a [[cutout above navel|cutout above her navel]] and [[long sleeves|long]] [[frilled sleeves]] with blue [[claw (weapon)|claws]], a [[blue belt]], a [[single over-kneehigh|single]] [[brown thighhighs|brown]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet]] [[over-kneehighs|over-kneehigh]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]] with blue [[colored shoe soles]]. She also wears a [[black collar|black]] [[spiked collar|spiked]] [[animal collar]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8492401: Merchandise (1)
* !post #7169538: Merchandise (2)
* !post #6544415: L2D (with [[Mococo Abyssgard (1st costume)|Mococo]])
other_names: フワワ・アビスガード(通常)

title: mococo_abyssgard_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mococo Abyssgard]].

It consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]] worn over a [[white shirt|white]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[t-shirt]] white [[arm warmers]] with floating [[claw (weapon)|claws]], [[white shorts|white]] [[frilled shorts|frilled]] [[short shorts]] with a [[pink belt]], [[brown socks|brown]] [[fishnet socks|fishnet]] [[kneehighs]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]] with pink [[colored shoe soles]]. She also wears a [[black collar|black]] [[spiked collar|spiked]] [[animal collar]] and a pair of [[headphones around neck]].

Due to an error in her original character sheet, her right sock is sometimes depicted without the fishnets.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8492469: Merchandise
* !post #6544415: L2D (with [[Fuwawa Abyssgard (1st costume)|Fuwawa]])
other_names: モココ・アビスガード(通常)

title: mococo_abyssgard_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mococo Abyssgard]], as seen on as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/rswxx/status/1743493431048233078]. 

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[spiked choker]] with a [[neck tassel]], a [[short kimono|short]] [[fur-trimmed kimono|fur-trimmed]] [[multicolored kimono|multicolored]] [[white kimono|white]] [[pink kimono|pink]] and [[black kimono|black]] [[floral print kimono|floral]] [[floral print|print]] [[print kimono|print]] with [[uneven sleeves]] (a long [[cross-laced sleeves|cross-laced sleeve]] reaching [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] on her left arm and a [[single bare shoulder]]), a [[pink shawl]], a [[pink sash|pink]] [[obi]] with a [[pink belt]] instead of an obijime, [[thigh strap]]s on both her legs, and [[black footwear|black]] [[paw shoes|paw]] [[boots]] with pink highlights. She also has optional [[paw gloves]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[short hair|short]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[sidelocks]], decorated with a [[hair flower]], a [[kanzashi]], a [[pom pom hair ornament]] and a [[kouhaku nawa]] [[hair bow]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7068770: Merchandise
* !post #7080071: L2D (with [[Fuwawa Abyssgard (new year)|Fuwawa]])

title: shizuku_lulu
body:
A [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] formerly associated with the inactive Ferret Girl's Academy, now independent. She is from Tokyo, Japan (as of 2023 she reportedly works in Shanghai), but streams primarily in Chinese on the Chinese platform [[BiliBili]] and is known for being the first VTuber to both study for and pass the Hanyu Shuiping Kaoshi (Chinese proficiency test) while being a VTuber. Because of this as a [[meme]] she is often referred to as "天选国V", or Chosen National V(Tuber).

Her illustrator is [[yutsumoe]].

It consists of a [[red hat|red]] [[mini santa hat]] with the Cover corp logo, a [[red choker]] witn a [[neck bell]], a [[short dress|short]] [[red dress|red]] [[fur-trimmed dress|fur-trimmed]]  [[off-shoulder dress|off-shoulder]] [[santa dress]] (although it's sometimes depicted as a [[strapless dress]] with [[detached sleeves]]), a [[black belt]] with [[gold chain]]s and the buckle shaped after the Cover logo, [[red thighhighs]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[fur-trimmed boots]].

On 2024, a white version of the costume was revealed.

title: moonlight_flower
body:
A relatively low-level boss in [[Ragnarok Online]]. She is a [[fox girl|fox]] demon who wields a large enchanted [[bell]] on a [[holding staff|staff]]. Her arena is located on the fifth floor of Payon dungeon. Her sprite is somewhat infamous for running around [[bottomless]], although later revisions have her with a [[criss-cross halter]] [[yellow bra]] and [[yellow panties]]. Whether or not she has a [[fox tail|tail]] is ambiguous, but most artists draw with her a [[fox hat]] and [[animal hands|animal]] [[animal feet|limbs]].

h4. See also

* [[Cat o' Nine Tails (Ragnarok Online)|]]: A similar miniboss who wears blue (and panties).
* [[Nine tail (ragnarok online)|]]: Her [[kitsune]] [[fox]]es that she summons

h4. External links

* "Ragnarok Wiki: Moonlight Flower":[https://ragnarok.fandom.com/wiki/Moonlight_Flower]

title: kagenarumono
body: [b]Kagenarumono[/b], often shortened to [b]Kage[/b], is a character in [[Street Fighter V]]. He is the Satsui no Hadou within [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] after being purged from his body. Essentially the [[Evil Ryu]] persona manifesting its own body, he appears as a [[doppelganger]] of Ryu, albeit with certain traits of [[Akuma (street fighter)|]] ([[dark skin]] and a [[kanji]] on his back) and his [[Kuruoshiki Oni|Oni]] form ([[demon horns]] and [[tusks]]).

title: help:api_read_requests
body:
These are API requests which use the HTTP GET or POST methods.

h4. Limit

Read requests are unlimited for all user levels.

h4. URL parameters

When doing a read through a GET request, the parameters must be passed in through the URL, and must use URL hash encoding ([[Help:Hash syntax]]).

h4. Body parameters

When doing a read through a POST request, the parameters must be passed in through the body. See the method override below for more information "[1]":[#dtext-method-override].

h5. URL encoding

These parameters use URL hash encoding ([[Help:Hash syntax]]).

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/x-www-form-urlencoded[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] PARAMETER=VALUE
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]search[name]=test&limit=20_method=get[/code]

h5. JSON encoding

These parameters use JSON hash encoding "[2]":[#dtext-external-links].

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/json[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] { "OBJECT": { "PARAMETER": VALUE } }
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]{ "search": { "name": "test" }, "limit": 20}[/code]

h4#method-override. Using POST for GET override

The POST method can be used to send data to endpoints that require the GET method, in such cases where the parameters must be sent in the body, such as the URL limit being exceeded.

h5. URL encoding

Set the parameter [code]_method[/code] with the value "get".

h5. JSON encoding

Set the [code]X-HTTP-Method-Override[/code] header with value "get".

h4. See also

* [[Help:API write requests]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[1] https://www.w3resource.com/JSON/structures.php

title: help:api_write_requests
body:
These are API requests which use the HTTP POST, PUT/PATCH or DELETE methods.

h4. Limit

These types of requests are rate-limited per user level ([[Help:Users]]). Burst writes is just where the available API writes caps off at. Regen rate is just how quickly the available writes get replaced after use.

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Member levels[/th]
[th]Burst writes[/th]
[th]Regen rate[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]Member[/td]
[td]10 API writes[/td]
[td]1 write/sec[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Gold[/td]
[td]30 API writes[/td]
[td]2 write/sec[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Platinum+[/td]
[td]60 API writes[/td]
[td]4 write/sec[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4. Parameters

The parameters for write requests must be passed along in the body instead of as part of the URL.

h5. URL encoding

These parameters use URL hash encoding ([[Help:Hash syntax]]), where the base object is the singular name of the endpoint.

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/x-www-form-urlencoded[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] OBJECT[PARAMETER]=VALUE
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]post[rating]=s&post[tag_string]=danboo[/code]

h5. JSON encoding

These parameters use JSON hash encoding "[1]":[#dtext-external-links], where the base object is also the singular name of the endpoint.

* [b]Content-Type:[/b] [code]application/json[/code]
* [b]Format:[/b] { "OBJECT": { "PARAMETER": VALUE } }
* [b]Example:[/b] [code]{ "post": { "rating": "s", "tag_string": "danboo" } }[/code]

h4. Using POST for method override

The POST method can be used to send data to endpoints that require other methods, in such cases where only one method is available, for instance [code]<form>[/code] HTML elements.

h5. URL encoding

PUT/PATCH and DELETE methods can also be sent by setting the parameter [code]_method[/code] with the name of the method as its value.

h5. JSON encoding

PUT/PATCH and DELETE methods can also be sent by setting the [code]X-HTTP-Method-Override[/code] header with the name of the method as its value.

h4. See also

* [[Help:API read requests]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[1] https://www.w3resource.com/JSON/structures.php

title: turn_a_gundam
body:
[i][b]Turn A Gundam[/b][/i] (stylized as [b]∀ Gundam[/b]) is a 1999 anime series written and directed by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] for the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]] series, marking his return to Sunrise after [[v_gundam|V Gundam]] in 1993.

Thousands of years into the future and in the aftermath of an ancient apocalyptic war, the "Earthrace" reverted to a Victorian-era lifestyle, while the more technologically advanced "Moonrace" went into cryostasis, waiting for the day they could repopulate the Earth, while occasionally sending advance scout parties to mingle with and spy on the Earthrace.

However, one such scout, [[Loran Cehack]], has since grew fond of the Earthrace, and when a Moonrace immigrant party began to stir trouble, Loran piloted the Turn A, a mobile suit worshipped as the "White Idol" by his adoptive nation, to not only prevent further conflict, but also bring peace between both races.

The series is notable because the peculiar looking hero [[mobile suit]] from the show and many other [[robot]]s were designed by an [[united_states|American]] artist ([[Syd Mead]]).

h4.See also

* [[Turn A Gundam (Mobile Suit)]]
* [[Turn X]]

* [[Orguss 02]] a 1993 mecha OVA with similar premise and [[steampunk]] setting.

title: orguss_02
body:
[b][i]Orguss 02[/i][/b] (オーガス 02, [i]Ōgasu Zero Tsū[/i]) is a 6 episode anime OVA released in Japan during 1993 and sequel to [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss|the original Orguss TV series]]. It is part of the [[Orguss]] franchise and has a peculiar [[steampunk]] setting. 

The OVA was later released on DVD in the US and UK by Manga Entertainment in the mid 90s.

title: henken_bekkener
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985.

[b]Henken Bekkener[/b] is a war veteran who was an [[Earth Federation]] [[Salamis Class]] battleship officer during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

Years later he became a capable and [[serious]] [[AEUG]] battleship captain. Henken was the first captain of the AEUG flagship, [i]The [[Argama]][/i] and later transfered his command to [i]The Radish[/i]. 

[spoiler]He dies at the final [[battle]] of The Gryps War after the bridge of his ship is attacked by [[Yazan Gable]] in his [[Hambrabi]], as Henken is desperately trying to give support fire to [[Emma Sheen]]'s [[Gundam Mk II]].[/spoiler]
other_names: ヘンケン・ベッケナー

title: matsuno_karamatsu
body:
[quote]
For a type of [[tree]] called kara-matsu in Japanese, use [[larch]].
[/quote]

A character from [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i] and its spin-offs. The second born son of the Matsuno family, he is characterized by his tidiness and fickle personality. In [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i], he is the most vain of the brothers and constantly tries to act cool, but with very little success. 

In the original series, he looks and acts identically to his brothers, but he is easily told apart by his large eyebrows and proud attitude in the sequel. He is also associated with the color blue.

title: mini_person
body:
A person that is extraordinarily small in size compared to their surroundings. Their small stature could be established against a humongous environment, or with normal sized characters.

If you can distinguish the gender of the small person, tag them as [[minigirl]] or [[miniboy]].

Non-living [[doll]]s aren't considered minipeople.

For a ordinary sized character and a miniperson in the same image, use [[size difference]]. If the larger character is holding the miniperson, use [[holding mini person]] or [[in palm]].

h4. See also

* [[chibi]]
* [[giant]]
* [[minigirl]]
* [[miniboy]]
* [[undersized animal]]

title: miniboy
body:
A male character that appears extraordinarily small compared to his surroundings. 

For miniature non-human characters like creatures and animals, see [[undersized animal]].

h4. See also

* [[chibi]]
* [[minigirl]]
* [[mini person]]
* [[giant male]]

title: minigirl
body:
A girl that is extraordinarily small in size compared to her surroundings. Her small stature could be established against a humongous environment, or with normal sized characters.

Girls who are small but not extraordinarily or unnaturally so are [[petite]] instead. Non-living [[doll]]s are not considered minigirls.

For the male counterpart to this tag, see [[miniboy]]. For non-humanoid characters like creatures and animals, see [[undersized animal]].

h4. See also

* [[chibi]]
* [[miniboy]]
* [[mini person]]
* [[giantess]]
* [[koonago]]

body:

title: kai_shiden
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] [[mecha]] TV series from 1979. Also appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985).

[b]Kai Shiden[/b] is a former civilian refugee and later member of the [[White Base]] junior crew who pilots the [[Guncannon]] [[mobile suit]] during The One Year War. Originally evasive about the war, he was initially a bit hateful and resented by [[Bright Noa]] and the rest of the White Base crew. On the surface, he was a jovial character, often sarcastic and lying to hide his embarrassment. However, war experiences make him grow and mature fast, changing his devious ways by the end of the conflict.

Years later he became a famous journalist. [spoiler]During this time, Kai took part in [i]The Gryps War[/i] as a [[aeug|Karaba]] intelligence officer spying on the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] bases on Earth. There he met and became friends with [[Reccoa Londe]] during a mission infiltrating the Titans base at Jaburo.[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Miharu Ratokie]]

title: highway
body:
A paved [[road]], typically [[multi-lane road|multi-lane]], designed for high-speed or long distance [[motor vehicle]] traffic, often between cities.  They're main public roads serving as high-speed thoroughfares.

The difference between a highway and a [[street]] is that a street is usually inside a [[city]] and designed for both vehicle and pedestrian traffic, with [[traffic light]]s, [[sidewalk]]s, and [[crosswalk]]s, while a [[highway]] is designed only for vehicles and doesn't have these features. A street is usually designed to allow access to nearby [[building]]s, while a highway usually has limited entry and exit points.

h4. Examples

* !post #3512835
* !post #5009481

h4. Types or features

* [[divided highway]]
* [[elevated highway]]
* [[multi-lane road]]

h4. See also

* [[Autobahn]]
* [[overpass]]
* [[road]]
* [[street]]
* [[tollbooth]]
* [[traffic]]
* [[underpass]]

title: multi-lane_road
body:
A [[road]] with two or more lanes going in each direction. If in the city with sidewalks and accessible to pedestrians then also add the [[street]] tag or if it's inaccessible then add the [[highway]] tag.

This tag may also be used if there are only two or more visible lanes going in the same direction.

h4. See also

* [[Divided highway]]
* [[Elevated highway]]

title: mahou_shoujo_ikusei_keikaku
body:
[b]Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku[/b] (魔法少女育成計画, lit. [i]Magical Girl Raising Project[/i], abbrev. [i]Mahoiku[/i]) is a magical girl action survival light novel series by Endou Asari. An anime adaptation by Lerche began airing Fall 2016 (Q4), covering the first arc "Unmarked."

When a picture only depicts a character's human form, please also tag their magical girl name as an umbrella tag for that character. When a picture only depicts a recurring protagonist, there is no need to tag the specific arc.

Please note that there are two identical mascots in the series: Fav and Fal. Fav only appeared in Unmarked, while Fal is a recurring character since Restart.

h4. Characters

h6. [[Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku Unmarked]]

* [[Snow White (mahoiku)|]] - human: [[Himekawa Koyuki]]

body:
A [[meme]] comparing [[Seong Gi-hun]]'s ID photo from the first season of [[Squid Game]] with his photo from the second season. The meme originated in a tweet from the official Netflix account on October 31, 2024.

The meme is typically used in a "[[before and after]]" format, featuring the character who seems happy/normal in the first panel, while the second panel feature them after either going through a certain traumatic experience or becoming serious.

title: yuuki_chihiro
body:
A former [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of the [[1st generation (nijisanji)|inaugural batch of eight]] and designed by [[Asacrebleu]]. 

Despite her name being displayed as [b]Yuki Chihiro[/b], her name, translated as-is, is meant to be read as [b]Yuuki Chihiro[/b]. She "announced":[https://twitter.com/Chihiro_yuki23/status/1734469459237273748] her graduation from Nijisanji effective January 31, 2024. 

She was portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied into [[twin braids]], and [[blue eyes]]. In addition, she also had an [[aged up]] version that varied per costume.

title: food_focus
body:
A post with a major focus on one or more items of [[food]] or [[drink]].

It is most often an [[original]] work, has [[no humans]], is a [[still life]], has a certain degree of [[realistic|realism]], and has a relatively [[simple background]]. Items are often contained within a [[tray]], [[bowl]], [[plate]], [[cup]], or [[saucer]].

If you need help in finding the name of a food, use [[food request]].

body:
A tall [[lamp]] that stands on the [[floor]]. It is usually taller than a [[desk lamp]].

Not to be used for small [[lantern]]s that sit on the floor. As a rule of thumb, only use for lamps you could turn on or off while standing.
