body:
An [[indoors|indoor]] light fixture placed on a table or floor to illuminate a room or brighten a work space. Lamps typically have a [[lampshade]] or some other covering to diffuse the light.

Not to be confused with [[lantern]]s, which are portable and often used [[outdoors]], or with [[lamppost]]s, which are also seen outdoors.

title: lantern
body:
A portable light source, designed to be carried or hung up, typically with an enclosure to protect it from the wind when used [[outdoors]].

Traditional lanterns use a [[candle]] or a wick dipped in oil, while modern lanterns use battery-powered lights.

For fixed [[outdoors]] lighting, use [[stone lantern]], [[wooden lantern]], or [[lamppost]] accordingly. Despite the name, the former two do not fall under this tag.

h4. Related tags

title: piano_(mega_man_megamix)
body:
Piano was a character designed by [[Ariga Hitoshi]] for the manga series [[Mega Man Megamix]]. She was meant to be a counterpart to [[Roll (mega man)|]] whose job was to control and watch over [[Bass (mega man)|]]. She has no weapons or combat ability of her own, instead having a large number of gadgets to control. She was designed to speak in a monotone, robotic voice: polite, but flat and devoid of emotion. Her purpose was to provide exposition to both the reader and the characters in the manga.

She was scrapped because Ariga felt that she would draw attention away from the stories, and there were many characters from the games that he wanted to give a deep characterization.

title: tangyuan
body:
Tangyuan is a type of boiled [[dumpling]] made from glutinous rice flour. It’s mixed with a small amount of water and shaped into round balls ([i]yuan[/i]) and cooked and in sweet or savory soup ([i]tang[/i]), then served immediately in a bowl. They come in a wide variety of colors and fillings from sugar to meat. They can also be fillingless, which are usually smaller in size. The most common, "default" one is white with sweet sesame paste.

Tangyuan are traditionally eaten during "Dongzhi festival":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dongzhi_Festival], [[Lantern Festival|Yuanxiao festival]] and served as a dessert on any occasions such as [[wedding|wedding day]], family reunion ect. In modern days they can be served as casually as an ordinary breakfast meal.

There is a technical difference between "tangyuan" and "yuanxiao". "Tangyuan" refers to the southern style, whereas "yuanxiao" refers to the northern style. The two are primarily differentiated by their method of preparation, texture and size, though they don't look that different from the outside.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tangyuan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tangyuan_(food)]
* "Wikipedia: Yuanxiao":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuanxiao]

title: lantern_festival
body:
The Lantern Festival is an event which marks the end of the [[Chinese New Year]] celebrations. It's Chinese name is Yuanxiao Festival, which refers to [[tangyuan]], the food that is eaten on the festival.

h4. See also

* [[Obon]]
* [[Sky lantern]]

title: jack-o'-lantern
body:
A vegetable [[lantern]] commonly carved from a [[pumpkin]], typically as a [[Halloween]] decoration. The pumpkin has a face or image carved into it, and the insides are usually scooped out so that a [[candle]] can be placed inside to illuminate the carving.

The practice originated from Ireland where they would use turnips or mangelwurzel to craft these lanterns for Halloween.  Irish immigrants brought this tradition to North America where it led to the development of carving pumpkins to make jack-o'-lanterns.

h4. See also

* [[unconventional jack-o'-lantern]] (made with something other than a pumpkin)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jack-o'-lantern":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack-o'-lantern]

This classic pose is usually a form of [[fidgeting]] brought on by being [[shy]], [[nervous]], [[embarrassed]] or the like. It may also be used on purpose in an attempt to look cute, or simply be the result of not knowing what to do with one's hands.

Do not use this tag for [[heart hands]] or the [[fusion dance]].

title: two-finger_salute
body:
A gesture with the thumb, index and middle fingers extended and raised in front of the head as a form of [[salute|saluting]].

There is another gesture called "two-finger salute", which is used mostly in Britain and other countries of the British Commonwealth and is an inverted version of the v-sign with the palm of the hand facing towards the one using the gesture instead of away from him. It is considered the British (Commonwealth) version of the [[middle finger]].

Not to be confused with [[kuji-in]], various [[ninja]] gestures that may involve extending the first two fingers, but not as a salute.

h4. See also

* [[kuji-in]]
* [[salute]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: fox_shadow_puppet
body:
A hand gesture created by placing the extended thumb, middle and ring fingers together while raising the little and index fingers upright. Creates a reasonable [[shadow puppet]] approximation of a [[fox]]. Commonly associated with [[kitsune]] and other [[fox girl]]s, since it is used in Japanese [[sign language]] as the sign for 'ki', derived from [[kitsune]].

Not to be confused with [[\||/]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1064629
* !post #3676010: [[Double fox shadow puppet]]

h4. Non-examples

* !post #7416767: [[\m/]] (🤟)
* !post #3253586: [[\n/]] (🤘)

h4. See also

* [[double fox shadow puppet]]
* [[fox shadow puppet kiss]]
* [[kitsune no mado]]
* [[\m/]] (🤟)
* [[\n/]] (🤘)
* [[\||/]]

title: kitsune_no_mado
body:
A practice from Japanese folklore where both hands are used to create a "window" gesture, which is then [[peeking_through_fingers|peered through]] to reveal hidden spirits, often youkai disguised as humans.

The gesture starts as both hands doing [[fox shadow puppet]]s. The hands are then rotated and opened such that the fingers interlace with each other, creating the window.

h4. Examples

* !asset #24230296: "The hand gestures":https://twitter.com/gazu100youkai/status/1000334485173387264

h4. See also

* [[finger frame]]
* [[fox shadow puppet]]

h4. External links

* "The Fox Window Game":https://theghostinmymachine.com/2021/08/18/the-most-dangerous-games-the-fox-window-game-or-how-to-see-ghosts/ 
* "Twitter: The hand gestures":https://twitter.com/gazu100youkai/status/1000334485173387264

title: abhaya_mudra
body:
A [[mudra]], which is a symbolic hand gesture from Hinduism and Buddhism. 

The right hand is held upright, and the palm is [[open hand|facing outwards]].

It symbolizes reassurance and safety, intended to dispel fear and accord divine protection and bliss.

h4. Examples

* !post #1000916

title: scarlet_(black_shadow)_(nikke)
body:
Character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

[spoiler]A mass-produced Nikke from the Melee Squad. The numerous modifications she has undergone mean that her physical capabilities are far superior to those of a typical mass-produced Nikke. Known as a swordsmanship genius, possessing extraordinary skills. [/spoiler]

Similar to [[Snow White (innocent Days) (nikke)|Snow White's younger self]], this version of [[Scarlet (Nikke)|]] is during her time as part of [spoiler] the Melee squad along with her sister [[Rose (Nikke)|]] and, later on, [/spoiler] the legendary [[Goddess (Nikke)|]] squad.

She has [[red eyes]], [[grey hair|grey]] [[long hair]] and [[large breasts]]. She carries a [[sword]] on one [[holding weapon|hand]] and its [[scabbard]] in the other. She wears [[black bodysuit]], [[shoulder plates]] on her right arm, and a [[half-skirt|half ragged skirt]] that is strapped to her hip by a tight [[belt]]. She also has what appears to be a red [[halo]].

title: sharon_carter
body: Sharon Carter (also known as Agent 13) is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by Stan Lee, Jack Kirby, and Dick Ayers, the character first appeared in Tales of Suspense #75 (March 1966). Sharon Carter is a secret agent and an ex-field agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. under [[Nick Fury]]. She is the main love interest of the superhero [[Captain America]] / [[Steve Rogers]]. Sharon Carter was originally the younger sister of [[Peggy Carter]]. She was later retconned as Peggy's grand-niece because of the unaging nature of comic book characters.

title: roboco-san
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]. A soft-spoken, high-performance [[android]]. [[Original|Originally designed]] by [[kuromaru9]] as an [[MMD]] character, but then later became a VTuber following the popularity boom of the medium.

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[brown hair|brown]] [[gradient hair]] with red tips. Being an [[android]], she has [[mechanical arms]] and [[mechanical legs]]. She is extensively modular and can appear with a combination of hairstyles and [[extra ears]], along with glasses and accessories. Her breast size is [[medium breasts|medium]] in her early models, though in later model update has increased it to the [[large breasts|large]] size. By default, she has [[short hair]] and [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]].

Due to her model being originally created for the use in [[mikumikudance|MMD]], her outfit is also extremely modular. She can appear with [[long hair]] in various hairstyles; [[teardrop-framed glasses]], an [[eyepatch]] or [[no eyewear]] at all and [[cat ears]], [[rabbit ears]] or no extra ears.

In February 2023 she got an update to her model that completely redesigned her lower body, adding an extra plate on her stomach giving the impression of a [[covered navel]] and her [[mechanical legs|robot legs]] now extend all the way to her waist and cover to outer side too, giving the impression of skintight pants, she now also has humanoid feet instead of claws.

h4. Costumes

She also now has a huge metallic "tail" spike protruding from her back, and an optional [[metal collar]] and [[broken handcuffs|broken]] [[handcuffs]] which were inspired by God Eater and a [[single horn]] protruding from her right temple - a nod to Venom Snake from Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain.

body:
Memes which reference the movie [[Morbius (film)|]], typically quoting either the famous catchphrase of the protagonist [[Morbius]] (played elegantly by [[Jared Leto]]): "It's Morbin' time", or the oft-quoted line from [spoilers]his final battle with the Anti-Morb[/spoilers]: "I am beginning to Morb..."

[spoilers]All of the quotes this meme revolves around are never actually said in the movie and are purely memetic, being fabricated to mock the actual movie, which is overwhelmingly panned by critics.[/spoilers]

She begins investigating mysterious murders and teams up with who she believes to be [[Tohno Shiki]] to help catch the killer, [spoiler][[Nise-Shiki|but who is in fact a serial murderer]][/spoiler].

Has the ability to predict the future and apparently loves to write [[Doujinshi]].

title: kanan_jarrus
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] series.

[b]Kanan Jarrus[/b] is one of the main protagonists of the [[Star Wars: Rebels]] animated TV series released in 2014.

title: star_wars:_rebels
body:
[b][i]Star Wars: Rebels[/i][/b] is an American [[3D]] CGI animated television series produced by Lucasfilm Animation and released in 2014.  It is a sequel to [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]].

It premiered as a 44-minute film, [i]Star Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion[/i], on October 3, 2014 on Disney Channel prior to the official premiere of the series on October 13 on Disney XD. So far 2 seasons have been released in 2014 and 2015, with a third season coming in September 24, 2016.

The show is set 14 years after [i]Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith[/i] and five years before [i]Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope[/i]. 

[i]Rebels[/i] takes place during an era when the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] is securing its grip on the galaxy. Imperial forces are hunting down the last of the [[Jedi]] Knights while a fledgling [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] against the Empire is taking form. 

Most of the visual style of Star Wars Rebels is notable because it is inspired by the [[Star Wars]] original trilogy concept art by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie .

A Japanese webcomic adapting the series began publication in 2019. The adaptation features art by [[Aoki Akira]] and is published by [[Line (naver)|]] in Japan, while physical volumes are translated and published overseas by Yen Press.

h4. See also

* [[Ezra Bridger]]
* [[Kanan Jarrus]]
* [[Hera Syndulla]]
* [[Sabine Wren]]
* [[Zeb Orrelios]]
* [[ghost_(spaceship)|Ghost]]

title: time_crisis_(series)
body:
A arcade light gun shooter series by [[Namco]]. A common theme with each entry of the game is the fictional intelligence agency VSSE (Vital Situation, Swift-Elimination) whose agents are protagonists in each game and the mercenary terrorist, Wild Dog, who serves as a recurring enemy boss in each game.

Since 2015, there have been five Time Crisis games, and three spin-off games.

title: exusiai_(arknights)
body:
[i]Exusiai, employee of Penguin Logistics, will clear out everything in the way using her guns[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lemuel

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]December 24[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A bright and cheerful gunner and operator from [[penguin_logistics_(arknights)|Penguin Logistics.]] She was sent to Rhodes Island along with her teammates as a liaison, where she assists with a variety of operations. Her choice of weapon is the [[Kriss Vector]] [[submachine_gun|sub-machine gun]].

A common theme in fanart is her love of [[apple pie]], based on her combat dialogue of shouting "apple pie".

As a Sankta, her motif is an angel. She has a bright halo above her head and small energy "wings" coming out of her back at all times, regardless of her clothes.

She has an older non-blood related sister named [[Lemuen (Arknights)|Lemuen]].

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are [[Iwami Manaka]] (Japanese), Cai Shujin (Chinese), Leonora Haig (English), and Lee Ji-hyun (Korean). Her original art designer  is [[huanxiang heitu]], while her [b]Midnight Delivery[/b] outfit is drawn by [[weiyu jiang]].

title: thorns_(arknights)
body:
[i]Thorns, Guard Operator of Rhodes Island, wastes not an ounce of energy, calculating each strike meticulously.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Isidor [tn](Tentative translation)[/tn]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Iberia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 17[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]177 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Born in the Iberian hinterland, Thorns left his hometown in the midst of local religious strife. After leaving, he was invited to join Rhodes Island. 

Knowledgeable in pharmacology and frequently experiments with various poisons and toxins, and is also exceptionally skilled in the Iberian swordsmanship technique known as [i]Destreza[/i]. His fencing teacher was [[Aulus (arknights)|]].

Easily misunderstood due to his blunt and uncaring demeanor, shrewd, and extremely forgetful regarding his appearance.

His motif is based on the black long-spined [[sea urchin]].

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Ishikawa Kaito]] (Japanese), Xu Xiang (Chinese), and Hong Bum-ki (Korean). His art designer is [[Huanxiang Heitu]].

The youngest member of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A6. She was left by her parents in a lumberyard after contracting Oripathy, but was later rescued by [[Ansel (arknights)|]] and [[Kal'tsit (arknights)|]].

She possesses a tremendous strenght and has a tendency to experience violent attacks, of which she has no recollection after the fact. Her infected eye also contains an unknown power, that must be kept hidden by the [[eyepatch]].

Her motif is based on the lop-eared [[rabbit]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ousaki Chiyo (Japanese), Chen Yanyi (Chinese), Kayli Mills (English) and Ryu Jeom-hee (Korean). Her original art designer is [[Xiayehongming]], while her new outfit is drawn by [[3MO]].

Vanilla is a [[blacksteel worldwide (arknights)|Blacksteel]] trainee, currently training and studying as part of exchange program with Rhodes Island. She has learned to use her race's combat abilities to her advantage, and performs well as a Vanguard.

She keeps pets in the base, most notably [[originium slug (arknights)|originium slugs]], as shown in her story segment during the [i]Stories of Afternoon[/i] event.

Uses a [[halberd|hellebarde]] as her weapon of choice.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Sugiura Shiori (Japanese), Ruoyu Zhang (Chinese), Stephanie Sheh (English), and Kang Sae-bom (Korean). Her original art designer is [[heibaise jiangshi]], while her outfit is drawn by [[3MO]].

title: idolmaster
body:
Idolmaster (アイドルマスター, stylized as [i]iDOLM@STER [/i]) is a 2005 video game series by [[Namco]] (later [[Bandai Namco]]), originally released for the arcade and subsequently for multiple platforms including Xbox 360, PlayStation Portable, Nintendo DS, PS3, PS4, PS5, and PC. The game follows the career of a producer from the 765 Production studio handling ten young [[idol]]s.

Eventually adapted into mutliple manga, a 2007 mecha re-imagining by [[Sunrise (company)|]], [[Idolmaster Xenoglossia]], and a more faithful 2011 anime which precedes the events of [[Idolmaster 2]]. The series has also spawned four mobile game spinoffs that focus on new groups of idols ([[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]], [[Idolmaster Million Live!]], [[Idolmaster Side-M]], and [[Gakuen Idolmaster]]), as well as spinoffs featuring all branches, such as [[Idolmaster Poplinks]]. It has also spawned a HTML5 platform game spinoff, [[Idolmaster Shiny Colors]], as well as a non-game VTuber spinoff in [[Idolmaster va-liv]].

title: dragon_quest
body:
An immensely popular Japanese RPG series developed by [[Square Enix]]—formerly by Enix separately—with character designs by [[Toriyama Akira]]. The series—especially the earliest games—heavily influenced the development of the genre in Japan. The series was never as popular in the west as [i][[Final Fantasy]][/i] due to delayed releases and the closure of Enix's North America office in the 1990s, but its profile has grown since the 2003 Square Enix merger.

Formerly known as [i]Dragon Warrior[/i] in North America until 2005, due to a trademark conflict over a tabletop roleplaying game of the same name.

h4. Games
h5. Main Series
* [i][[Dragon Quest I]][/i] (1986)
* [i][[Dragon Quest II]][/i] (1987)
* [i][[Dragon Quest III]][/i] (1988)
* [i][[Dragon Quest IV]][/i] (1990)
* [i][[Dragon Quest V]][/i] (1992)
* [i][[Dragon Quest VI]][/i] (1995)

h5. Spin-offs

title: apolly_bay
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]Apolly Bay[/b] is a veteran [[AEUG]] mobile suit pilot and one of [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s wingmen. His [[mobile_Suit|MS]] of choice is the [[Rick Dias]], initially painted black and grey, then red.

[spoilers]Apolly used to be a [[Zeon]] MS pilot (Real name: Andy) during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. He dies in one of the last space battles of The Gryps War, killed when his Rick Dias was destroyed by [[Jerid Messa]]'s [[Byalant]] while taking part in [i]Operation Maelstrom[/i].[/spoilers]

title: black_clover
body:
A battle shounen manga by [[tabata_yuuki|Yuuki Tabata]]. The story centers around [[asta_(black_clover)|Asta]], a young boy born without any magic power in a fantasy world of magicians. It has been serialized in Shueisha's Weekly Shounen Jump magazine since February 2015. An anime adaptation produced by Pierrot aired in Japan on TV Tokyo from October 2017 to March 2021.

h4. See also

* [[Black Clover: Sword of the wizard king]]
* [[Black Catcher (Black clover)|]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://bclover.jp/]
* "Wikipedia: Black Clover":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Clover]

title: peggy_carter
body: Margaret Elizabeth "Peggy" Carter, also known as Agent Carter, is a fictional character in the [[Marvel |marvel comics]] media franchise.

title: eve_(stellar_blade)
body:
Main character from [[Stellar Blade]]. Her name is stylized as "EVE".

A commando of the 7th Airborne Division of the Space Colony. Eve was sent to Earth in a combat mission against Earthlings, but her entire unit was wiped out. She was saved by [[Adam (Stellar Blade)|]], and began her journey to adapt and survive in her new home.

EVE is a [[tall female|tall woman]] with a [[long legs]], [[medium breasts]], [[brown eyes]] and a [[black hair]]. Her default hairstyle is a [[very long hair|very long]] [[ponytail]] with a [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[medium bangs]]. She has various small [[mole]]s across her body and face. Her default outfit is a [[Planet Diving Suit (7th) (Stellar Blade)|]] Nano suit. She also wears different types of heels depending on the outfit the player chooses. Her [[sword]] Blood Edge folds up and functions as a [[hairclip]] for her ponytail when not in use.

h4. See also

* [[Skin suit (Stellar Blade)|]]

h4. External links

* "Stellar Blade Wiki: EVE":https://stellarblade.fandom.com/wiki/EVE

title: tem_ray's_circuit
body:
A fictional electronic device from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

It is a technological gadget created by [[Tem Ray]] intended to enhance the abilities of any [[mobile suit]]. [spoilers]It does not work properly, as Tem was already brain damaged while developing it.[/spoilers]

title: zentreya_(mmo_zen)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Zentreya]], and her 3rd as part of her [[Zentreya (cyborg)|cyborg]] appearance, as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/yuniiho/status/1705404634976883123].

Getting ready to play some [[video game]]s with her friends, Zen slips on her new [[loungewear]]. This outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[purple shirt]], with a [[character print|picture of her]] [[gecko zen|chibi]]-selves face on it, [[black pants]], and [[snom]] [[slippers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has [[long hair|long]] [[messy hair|messy]] [[grey hair]] that she keeps down with a [[black headband]].

It is a [[cowboy western|cowboy]]-style bikini set, consisting of a [[cowboy hat]], a [[brown vest|brown]] [[vest|cowboy vest]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]], a [[red scarf]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[black belt]] with her Gecko forms face on it and a [[american flag bikini]].

title: hibiki_dan
body:
[i]I hate the [[Ryuuko no Ken|art of fighting]], but I wanna be [[the king of fighters]]![/i]
--Dan Hibiki, [[street fighter zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]]

[b]Dan Hibiki[/b], known simply as [b]Dan[/b], is a character from [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]] franchise who first debuted in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]. Dan is consistently portrayed as an arrogant, overconfident, yet utterly weak character in many of the games he is featured in. He is widely considered to be the comic relief of the series because of his over-the-top poses and battle cries.

He is originally created as a jab on [[SNK]]'s [[Ryuuko no Ken]] characters [[Ryou Sakazaki]] and [[Robert Garcia]], whom Capcom viewed as a rip-off of [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] and [[Ken masters|Ken]] respectively. Notably featuring numerous taunts from SNK's own fighting game franchise [[The King of Fighters]].

A (self-proclaimed) [[Hong Kong]]er martial artist of Japanese origin. Dan's father, [[Hibiki Gou]], was a rival of [[Sagat]]. Gou gouged out Sagat's right eye and Sagat beat him to death in retaliation. Because of this, Dan sought revenge on Sagat, training to become a fighter, but was expelled from [[Gouken]]'s dojo when his motivations were learned. Dan thus developed his own style of Gouken's martial art merged with Muay Thai elements and called it Saikyo-ryu, "The Strongest Style", despite the complete weakness of his techniques.

Unlike the rest of the Street Fighter cast Dan can taunt while crouching or jumping. He even has a "super taunt" that uses up his entire super meter to perform the greatest and flashiest taunt in the world.

title: hibiki_gou
body: A non-playable character in the [[Street Fighter]] series and the late father of [[Hibiki Dan]] and [[Hibiki Yuriko]].

title: hibiki_yuriko
body: A character from Capcom's [[Street Fighter]] series. She is the younger sister of [[Hibiki Dan]], first appearing in his ending in [[Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter]] in a sequence that parodies [[Ryou Sakazaki]]'s ending in the first [[Ryuuko no Ken]]. She later returned in [[Street Fighter V]] and [[Street Fighter 6]] as a shopkeeper in the Shop menu and the Battle Hub respectively.

title: magia_record:_mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica_gaiden
body:
[i]Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden[/i] is a smartphone game based on [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i]. The English version of the game ended its service "October 30, 2020":https://magiarecord-en.com/news/?id=54966. An anime was "announced":https://twitter.com/magireco/status/1035863465607360512 in early September of 2018. The anime adaption is by Shaft studio with 3 seasons airing from Winter 2020 - Spring 2022. There is also a manga adaption written by Magica Quartet with art by [[Fuji Fujino]].

title: kuro_(magia_record_anime)
body:
[i] Not to be confused with [[Kuro (magia record game)|Kuro (Magia Record Game)]] or [[Kuroe (Madoka Magica)|]].[/i]

A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

h4. Appearance

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. Her eyes are [[covered eyes|never visible]].

In her daily life, she wears the [[Takarazaki school uniform]] paired with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and a [[ring]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears a [[white capelet|white]] [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[capelet]] with a [[hooded capelet|hood]], a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[neck ribbon]] with a [[pink gemstone]], a [[pink ascot|pink]] [[ascot]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fur-trimmed gloves|fur-trimmed]] [[gloves]] that make it seem like she has [[no fingers]] (or alternatively, [[brown mittens|brown]] [[fur-trimmed mittens|fur-trimmed]] [[mittens]]; [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] and [[large shoes|large]] [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

* !asset #24600527
* !asset #24600531: [[Magical girl]]

title: link
body:
The protagonist of [i][[The Legend of Zelda]][/i]. He is usually depicted as a young boy or a teenager in green clothing who grows to become a hero. He bears the [[Triforce]] of Courage and in many games is the wielder of the [[Master Sword]].

There are several distinct incarnations of Link throughout the entirety of the [i]Legend of Zelda[/i] series, though they share a number of common characteristics.

title: the_legend_of_zelda:_twilight_princess
body:
[i]The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess[/i] is the thirteenth installment in the [[The Legend of Zelda]] series, developed by [[Nintendo]] for the [[Wii]] (see [[Wii Version]]) and [[GameCube]].

The story focuses on [[Link]], who tries to prevent Hyrule from being engulfed by the Twilight Realm. To do so, he takes the form of both a Hylian and a [[Wolf link|wolf]], and is assisted by a mysterious creature named [[Midna]]. The game takes place hundreds of years after [[the_legend_of_zelda:_ocarina_of_time|Ocarina of Time]] and [[the_legend_of_zelda:_majora's_mask|Majora's Mask]], in an alternate timeline from [[the_legend_of_zelda:_the_wind_waker|The Wind Waker]].

title: apron
body:
An apron is an outer protective garment that covers primarily the front of the body.  It may be worn for hygienic reasons as well as in order to protect clothes from wear and tear. The apron is commonly part of the uniform of several work categories, including waitresses, nurses, and maids.  It is also worn as a decorative garment by women.

title: aika_himena
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is the leader of Neomagius, an organization claiming Magical Girl Supremacy.

h4. Appearance

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with [[blunt ends]], [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]] and [[purple eyes]].

In her daily life, she has her hair tied into a [[half updo]], and wears the [[Kamihama Future Academy school uniform]] paired with [[earrings]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], her hair is tied into a [[bow-shaped hair|bow]], and she wears a [[sleeveless kimono|sleeveless]] [[purple kimono|purple]] [[kimono]] [[cropped kimono|crop top]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[furisode]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print sleeves|print]], a [[red ribbon|red]] and [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[ribbon]] tied into a [[flower knot]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[purple skirt|purple]]/[[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] decorated with a [[purple gemstone]], an [[anklet]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[toeless footwear|toeless]] [[boots]]. She also has [[stomach tattoo|stomach]] and [[leg tattoo]]s, and fights with a [[pink shawl|pink]] [[hagoromo]].

* !asset #23383482
* !asset #23383481: [[Magical girl]]

* "The Puella Magi Wiki: Himena Aika":[https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Himena_Aika]

title: skirt
body:
A skirt is a tube- or cone-shaped garment which hangs from the waist and covers all or part of the legs.

A [[dress]] should not be tagged with [[skirt]]. A dress is a one-piece outfit, while a skirt is a separate piece of clothing.

title: kuro_(magia_record_game)
body:
[i]Not to be confused with [[Kuro (Magia Record Anime)]] or [[Kuroe (Madoka Magica)|]].[/i]

An anonymous [[feather (magia record)|Black Feather]] from [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

Her real name is unknown, though she asked to be referred to as "匿名希望" ([i]tokumei kibou[/i], lit. "anonymous hope") in the Japanese version of the game, and as "Jane Doe" in the North American localization. Despite that, her character card calls her "黒" ([i]Kuro[/i], lit. "black").

She does not have a unique design, rather, she simply uses the regular Black Feather model with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. Whether or not any Black Feather is specifically Kuro should be determined from context, such as:
* being presented in conjunction with [[Akemi Homura]], or the holiday of Valentines,
* being presented in conjunction with her [[Witch (madoka magica)|]]/[[Doppel (Madoka magica)|]] form - [[Matasaburo (madoka magica)|]],
* being presented in conjunction with [spoilers]other dead characters, such as [[Yukino Kanae]], [[Anna Mel]] or [[Sarasa Hanna]][/spoilers],
* her name being used.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24600516

title: lance
body:
A type of [[polearm]], traditionally used by [[cavalry]] or in [[jousting]], which has a distinct and large cone for its head intended to maximize the thrusting power on impact. The cone can be as long as, or even longer, than the actual haft. Lances are a popular symbol for a [[knight]].

Not to be confused with "lances" in [[Fire Emblem]] games, which improperly use the term to refer to any kind of spear, or "[[lance (senjou no valkyria)|]]s" in [[senjou no valkyria (series)|Valkyria Chronicles]], which are a line of rocket launchers.

h4. Examples

* !post #5971480

h4. See also

* [[Jousting]]
* [[Polearm]]
* [[Spear]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: lance_(senjou_no_valkyria)
body:
A category of man-portable heavy projectile weapons used in the [[senjou no valkyria (series)|Valkyria Chronicles]] series of games.  They normally played the role as an anti-tank weapon and were designed to launch anti-tank rockets.  Mortar versions also existed for anti-infantry roles, usually visually identifiable by the grenade-like projectile they use compared to the cone-shaped rockets of the anti-tank lances.  The weapons were most commonly shaped like traditional melee [[lance]]s, especially those used by the Empire and the Principality of Gallia.  Federation lances did not share the lance-like appearance of the other game factions.

h4. Examples

* !post #1119799: Anti-tank lance 
* !post #1171475: Mortar lance

h4. See also

* [[Rocket launcher]]

title: yandere
body:
A character who alternates between a dangerously obsessive and a loving ([[deredere]]) personality.

Their affection mixes with extreme insecurities to create a type of love that is entirely insane and generally violent. The homicidal feelings differ from character to character. Some direct their attacks against the one whom they desire, while others direct it against anyone who gets too close to the person they love.

This tag is for characters displaying this personality trait through their words or actions. Do not use it simply because the character is canonically yandere.

h4. Examples

* !post #2426144
* !post #5958139

h4. Notable characters

* [[Gasai Yuno]] from [[Mirai Nikki]], an example of aggression against anyone getting too close to her love interest.
* [[Katsura Kotonoha]] from [[School Days]], an example of aggression towards a love interest.
* [[Yamagishi Yukako]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], a character that is often described as the progenitor of the archetype. 

h4. See also

* [[nata (tool)|]]
* [[tsundere]]
* [[yandere trance]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Obsessive love disorder":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsessive_love_disorder
* "TVTropes: Yandere":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Yandere

body:
When a character is [[holding]] a [[cleaver]].

Not to be confused with holding a [[nata (tool)|]], the weapon wielded by [[yandere]]s.

title: nata_(tool)
body:
A usually double-handed striking tool with a sharp rectangular blade used to cut and split wood. It resembles an oversized [[cleaver]].

It also is an archetypical [[yandere]] weapon.

h4.See also

* [[hashitsuki nata]]
* [[hatchet (axe)]]
* [[cleaver]]
* [[list of weapons]]

title: cleaver
body:
A single-handed butcher's [[knife]] with a square blade resembling a small [[nata (tool)|]]. 

Cleavers come in two sizes, small and full size. Small cleavers are generally for home use, they are 180-210mm (7-8inch) in length. Full size cleavers are for professional/restaurant use, they are 220-250mm (9-10 inch). 

If the blade is bigger and/or it's double-handed it's a [[nata (tool)|]], a common weapon for a [[yandere]]. 

h4. See also 

* [[nata (tool)|]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: witch_(madoka_magica)
body:
Entities from the series [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]], said to manifest due to negative emotions and actions in the world ([spoiler]specifically from magical girls[/spoiler]). Upon targeting their victims they leave a mark called a Witch's Kiss (魔女の口づけ). To conceal themselves the witches create [[witch's_labyrinth|barriers]].

Each witch appears to be accompanied by a [[familiar (Madoka Magica)|]] (使い魔).

title: powering_up
body:
When a character is readying an [[energy]] attack, [[casting spell|casting a spell]], or performing some other act that has a visual manifestation of their focusing energy, usually with the implication that this energy is going to be used offensively.

Not to be confused with [[power-up]].

h4.See also

* [[aura]]
* [[electricity]]
* [[energy ball]]
* [[energy ring]]
* [[light particles]]
* [[magic]]

title: spear
body:
A type of [[polearm]] consisting of a sharp point or blade at the end of a long shaft, traditionally for thrusting. One of the most common [[polearm]]s.

h4. See also

* [[Halberd]]
* [[Harpoon]]
* [[Javelin_(spear)|]]
** [[Pilum]]
* [[Lance]]
* [[Pike (weapon)|]]
* [[Yari]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spear":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spear

title: trident
body:
A type of [[polearm]] that ends with three prongs. Typically used for fishing, but also used in reference to aquatic or [[demon]]ic beings.

Use [[pitchfork]] instead if the endpoints are not sharp nor barbed, or [[sai (weapon)|]] if the weapon is short.

h4. See also

* [[Polearm]]
* "Oversized fork search":[/posts?tags=oversized_object+fork]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Trident":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trident

title: pitchfork
body:
A multi-pronged agricultural tool used to lift and pitch (throw) loose materials such as hay, grass, manure, or other such materials.

If the points are barbed and sharp, use [[trident]] instead.

h4. See Also

* [[Polearm]]
* "Oversized fork search":[/posts?tags=oversized_object+fork]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: bishamonten's_spear
body: In [[Touhou]], the spear of Bishamonten is an artifact belonging to [[Toramaru Shou]]. It is usually depicted as [[spear]], but also as a [[trident]], [[lance]] or [[halberd]].

title: sai_(weapon)
body:
A short three-pronged stabbing [[weapon]]. It used in the Ryukyu old martial arts.

h4. See also

title: school_uniform
body:
A uniform commonly worn by students of various grades depending on the country; in Japan, they're mostly worn by middle school and high school students. The two most common designs are the [[serafuku]] and [[blazer]].

Common accessories can include: [[sweater]], [[cardigan]], [[sweater vest]], [[thighhighs]], and [[kneehighs]]. A [[gakuran]] is a popular uniform worn by boys. A common footwear for both genders while in school is the [[uwabaki]].

All {{*_school_uniform}} tags automatically add the [[school uniform]] tag.

[Expand=Types]
* !post #7610906: [[Serafuku]]
* !post #37372: [[Gakuran]]

title: dark_matter_(kirby)
body:
A recurring boss and villain in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series who posesses others, most notably [[King Dedede]]. It is one of the ultimate villains of the series and the second one to appear after [[Nightmare_(kirby)|]].

Its motives are unclear, but there are theories that Dark Matter lived a lonely existence in the galaxy and decided, "If I cannot be happy, no one can." So it made several attempts to dominate the universe by spreading its dark influence in the form of dark clouds all over planets that take control of the minds of whoever they possess.

Dark Matter is controlled by [[Zero_(kirby)|]], the second resident universal dominator and ultimate evil in Kirby's universe after Nightmare.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24599725: [[Dark Matter Blade]]
* !asset #24599730: Real Dark Matter

h4. Members

The franchise releases these costumes through many different methods:

title: holding_shinai
body: Use [[holding sword]] + [[shinai]].

title: shinai
body:
A [[kendo]] practice [[sword]] made of [[bamboo]] strips. 

It is the standard wooden training [[weapon]] for sparring and formal competitions in kendo, as it is unlikely to injure the competitors (especially with the padded armor required in kendo tournaments).

h4. See also

* [[bokken]]
* [[sword]]
* [[weapon bag]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: bokken
body:
A lethal [[kendo]] practice [[sword]] made of solid, heavy wood. It's shaped and balanced like a [[katana]]. 

Bokken are normally used for solo training, not for sparring. For that, the [[shinai]] is used, as sparring with a bokken will usually lead to broken bones... or worse. 

Legendary [[samurai]] swordmaster [[Miyamoto Musashi]] is said to have fought and killed [[katana]]-wielding rival samurai by using just a bokken against them.

h4. See also

* [[shinai]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: princess_reconquista

title: omikuji
body:
Random fortunes written on strips of paper at [[Shinto]] [[shrine]]s in Japan. Tying these strips of paper to trees or wires is a common custom, especially when receiving a negative fortune.

The short messages that may be found on them follow below, ordered tentatively from worst to best:

* 大凶 (dai-kyou), Great Curse
* 末凶 (sue-kyou), Future Curse
* 半凶 (han-kyou), Half-Curse
* 小凶 (shou-kyou), Small Curse
* 凶 (kyou), Curse
* 末小吉 (sue-shou-kichi), Future small Blessing
* 末吉 (sue-kichi), Future Blessing
* 半吉 (han-kichi), Half-Blessing
* 吉 (kichi), Blessing
* 小吉 (shou-kichi), Small Blessing
* 中吉 (chuu-kichi), Middle Blessing
* 大吉 (dai-kichi), Great Blessing

The temples and shrines across Japan do not have a unified system for their omikuji. Some places do not offer the full range of fortunes, and a few offer an additional fortune rank:
* 平 (hira), Neutral

How the unmodified "Blessing" ranks compare to Small and Middle blessings also varies.

h4. See also

* [[tied omikuji]]

title: glaive_(polearm)
body:
A glaive is a European [[polearm]] weapon, consisting of a single-edged blade on the end of a pole. It is similar to the Japanese [[naginata]] and the Chinese [[guan dao]].

The term "glaive" has also been repurposed in certain (primarily Western) fantasy series to describe an oversized throwing weapon resembling a [[shuriken]], [[chakram]] or [[throwing knife]]. [b]Do not[/b] tag these examples as glaive; use the appropriate tags instead.

h4. Notable characters
* [[Tatsuta_(kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Hellion (darkest_dungeon)|]] ([[Darkest Dungeon]]) 
* [[Sailor Saturn]] ([[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]])
** Her Silence Glaive is technically a glaive[i]-fork[/i], but we currently don't distinguish. [tn]And we probably shouldn't.[/tn]


h4. Tag usage notes
* Tag glaive when you see the polearm weapon described above.
* Avoid tagging glaive when the weapon can be more appropriately described with another polearm tag.
** e.g. [[naginata]], [[nagimaki]], [[guan dao]], [[scythe]], [[halberd]], [[bardiche]], [[billhook]]
* [b]Do not[/b] tag throwing weapons with glaive.
** Even if they are called "glaive" in the series. Use the appropriate throwing weapon tag instead.
** Unless some crazy person decides to use actual polearm glaives as 'throwing weapons'.


h4. See also

* [[Naginata]]
* [[Nagimaki]]
* [[Guan dao]]
* [[Scythe]]
* [[Halberd]]
* [[Bardiche]]
* [[Billhook]]
* [[Double blade]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Glaive":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glaive]

title: steel_haze
body: The AC piloted by [[V.IV Rusty]], light weight [[reverse-jointed legs|reverse jointed]] AC made up entirely of Nachtreiher produced parts, [[huge_weapon|armaments]] include shoulder mounted plasma [[missile pod]], burst handgun, burst assault rifle and an [[energy_blade|energy]] [[double blade]]. Painted in predominantly admiral/azure blue and grey.

title: saberstaff
body: An [[energy sword]]/[[double blade]] from the [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] universe, it is the kind of [[lightsaber]] [[Darth Maul]] used. Originally created by the [[Sith]], [[Jedi]] have also used such weapons. [[Bastila Shan]] and [[Satele Shan]] are notable example of such.

title: lady_maria_of_the_astral_clocktower
body:
Character from From Software's [[Bloodborne]].

Lady Maria is a renowned Huntress who comes from Cainhurst, and is related to Queen Annalise of the Vilebloods. She was trained under the tutelage of [[gehrman_the_first_hunter|Gehrman]].

Despite being of Cainhurst descent, she refused to use either blood magic or the Chikage; Instead, her trick weapon of choice is the [[Rakuyo_(bloodborne)|Rakuyo]], a [[double blade|Two-edged sword]] which can be separated.

[spoiler]She has an extreme resemblance to [[plain_doll|The Plain Doll]]. This is because Gehrman, who had a secret infatuation with Maria whilst training her, modeled the Doll after her.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After being trapped within the Hunter's Nightmare, she sought to defend the Fishing Hamlet that was ravaged by Byrgenweth from anyone aiming to get into it. As such, she serves as the penultimate plot-mandated boss of the DLC.[/spoiler]

title: heavy_spear_(evangelion)
body: A massive [[double blade]]s used by [[Mass Production Eva]]ngelions against [[Eva 02|Unit-02]] in [[The End of Evangelion]]. [spoilers]They are actually masked replicas of the [[Lance of Longinus (Evangelion)|]] and are able to transform to their original [[bident]] form (but grey instead of red).[/spoilers]

title: bardiche_(riot_blade_ii)_(nanoha)
body:
[[Bardiche (nanoha)|]]'s upgraded default melee form in [[Mahou Senki Lyrical Nanoha Force]].

Takes the base appearance of an [[energy sword]]. This sword has a more ornate axe-shaped hilt and curvier blade compared to those on the older [[Bardiche (riot blade) (nanoha)|Riot Blade]] and Riot Zanber forms.

The Riot Blade II can appear as:
* A single energy sword, like the older [[Bardiche (riot blade) (nanoha)|Riot Blade]] form.
* Twin energy swords, like [[Bardiche (riot zanber stinger) (nanoha)|Riot Zanber Stinger]]. Unlike Riot Zanber Stinger this form does not have the "mana string" connecting both pommels.
* Two energy swords fused hilt-to-hilt into a single [[double blade|double-ended 'sword']].

title: xi_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It is the lead Gundam of [[Gundam Hathaway's Flash]].

The [b]RX-105 Xi Gundam[/b] and the [[Penelope (Hathaway's Flash)|RX-104FF Penelope]] were classified as fifth-generation MS and are said to have been developed and constructed by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. It was a unique [[mobile_suit|MS]] with a built-in Minovsky Flight Unit and was equipped with the latest Beam Barrier system. Since the Penelope relied on optional units to obtain similar functions, it can be said that the Xi Gundam was a truly completed fifth-generation MS that could function independently.

Its armaments include a [[beam rifle]], a pair of [[energy sword|beam sabers]] (with a [[double blade]] function similar to the [[Nu Gundam]]'s large beam saber), a [[shield]] with a [[beam cannon]] on its tip, forearm-mounted triple missiles, and its signature [i]Funnel Missiles[/i]. True to its name, these [[funnels (gundam)|]] functions like remote controlled [[missile|missiles]], guided by the pilot's Newtype abilities and exploding upon impact. These weapons are also equipped on the Penelope.

It is piloted by [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]], [spoiler]a.k.a. [[Hathaway Noa]][/spoiler]. Designed in [[real life]] by [[Moriki Yasuhiro]] for the novel; the design was later updated by [[Fujita Kazumi]] for the [[SD Gundam G-Generation]] series; this updated design has been used in most [[video game]]s where the Xi Gundam is featured, such as Gundam Extreme Vs. and Super Robot Wars. [[Katoki Hajime]] also designed it for the FIX Figuration line as well as gave it a minor visual overhaul for the movie, featuring larger hands, a more off-white color scheme and a generally bulkier silhouette.

title: the_constellation_(apex_legends)
body: [[Fade (apex legends)|]]'s signature weapon in [[Apex Legends Mobile]]. A set of [[claw (weapon)|]]s that transform into a [[double blade]]d [[knife]].

title: steel_haze_ortus
body: The second AC piloted by [[V.IV Rusty]], a light weight bipedal AC made up entirely of Elanco produced parts of the 'ALBA' series, changing its [[huge_weapon|armaments]] arsenal entirely, incorporated a [[drone|bullet orbit]] into it's armaments, keeping only the [[energy_blade|energy]] [[double blade]] from [[Steel Haze]]. Similar to Steel Haze, Ortus is also painted in predominantly admiral/azure blue and grey.

title: lamia_(npc)_(pgr)
body:
Lamia's NPC / boss appearance, prior to the patch 'Cradle Parade'.

h5. Appearance
Lamia is [[cyborg]] / [[monster girl]] in appearance, depicted either in a dinosaur (with [[reverse-jointed legs]] and vertical tail fin) or a [[mermaid]] like lower body with horizontal fin [[fish tail]]. Lamia has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[dark blue hair]], overall hair length is [[long hair|long]], has [[long bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between eyes]]. Lamia has bodily features like [[purple eyes|purple]] [[ringed eyes]], sometimes with [[bags under eyes]].

Her skintone is [[pale skin|pale]], both arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] and wears a large [[headgear]]. Her only clothing element are a pair of [[breast curtains]], but it has similar colour to her mechanical arms, depending on depiction it can look like she is wearing a [[shrug (clothing)|]].

Uses a [[polearm]] [[double blade]] as weapon, but the smaller blade can be detached and use as a [[sword]] / [[dual wielding]].

title: two-bladed_sword
body: See [[double blade]].

title: vera:_rozen_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Vera (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Rozen features [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[red hair]] past her waist, with a [[black hairband]], a black [[hair ribbon]] fitted on the back of her head, [[hair between eyes|bangs between eyes]], long [[sidelocks]], and [[red eyes]] with a single [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

Other apparels includes a [[ribbon]] on the chin, [[white bodysuit]] with black [[long sleeves]], and [[spiked pauldrons]] / [[shoulder armor]]. Can be shown with or without an [[eyepatch]] on the left eye, as well as a mechanical [[headgear]] depending on awakening level.

She uses a [[katana]] / [[sword]] as weapon on her main hand, and another sword with a specialized hilt on her off hand, the two can combine and form a [[double blade]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[vera: rozen (night fever) (pgr)|Night Fever]]
* [[vera: rozen (agony break) (pgr)|Agony Break]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Vera: Rozen Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Vera:_Rozen/Gallery]

title: hatsune_miku_x_kodo
body:
A series of live concerts featuring a collaboration between Crypton Future Media and the Japanese drumming group [b]Kodo, Taiko Performing Arts Ensemble[/b].

The performance included various [[Vocaloid]] songs featuring [[Hatsune Miku]], [[Kagamine Rin]]/[[kagamine len|Len]], and [[Megurine Luka]] playing alongside the drummers. The first concert took place in 2017, a sequel in 2018, and the final concert (also including [[MEIKO (Vocaloid)|]] and [[KAITO (Vocaloid)|]]) in 2023.

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid Games and Events]]

title: daihatsu_move_canbus
body:
The [b]Daihatsu Move Canbus[/b] is a van-style [i]kei[/i] car manufactured by Japanese automobile manufacturer Daihatsu starting in 2016. Despite its name, it is not based on the same platform as the regular Daihatsu Move (which is a more conventionally styled [i]kei[/i] car). As of model year 2022, the Move Canbus is in its second generation. The first-generation model is particularly notable for the [[Hatsune Miku]] edition, which was a special [[Vocaloid]]-themed deco package offered in collaboration with Crypton Future Media for the 2017 model year.

According to Daihatsu, the name "Canbus" is a portmanteau of "can", meant to imply that the car is capable, and "bus" from its [[Volkswagen Type 2]]-inspired body styling.

title: vocaloid
body:
VOCALOID is a DTM (Desktop Music) singing synthesizer engine developed by [[Yamaha]] Corporation in collaboration with Pompeu Fabra University. 

VOCALOID products are created by various individual studios that develop voicebanks using the most current engine tools. The first set of synthesizer vocals was released in January 2004.

On August 31st, 2007, [[Hatsune Miku]] was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. As the first product in Crypton Future Media's Character Vocal Series, she was the first voicebank designed with an anime-styled avatar representing the singer of the voicebank. Her immediate and immense popularity led to nearly all future voicebanks following the same trend of having an anime-styled avatar, a trend that still continues to this day.

The popularity of VOCALOID has inspired the creation of [[List of vocal synthesizers|similar products]].

h4. See also

* [[Vocaloid editor]]
* [[List of VOCALOID characters]]
* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]
* [[List of VOCALOID games and events]]

title: kasane_teto
body:
A [[UTAU]] character with [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]].

She is a young girl with [[red eyes]] and [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]]. She typically wears a dark blue/gray outfit with red trim. Her official profile lists her as a "chimera", so she is sometimes given characteristics like a forked tail or wings. Her character item is a [[baguette]]. 

She was created as an April Fools joke by the VIPPERs of 2ch, meant to trick Nico-Nico Douga users into thinking she was the 3rd Vocaloid from Crypton. After the joke was over, instead of fading into obscurity Teto was picked up by [[UTAU]], a freeware knock-off of [[VOCALOID]]. She has maintained a level of popularity, and many have tried to replicate this effect with other joke and fanmade characters since.

After her 15th anniversary on April 2023, she received an [[kasane teto (sv)|updated voicebank]] under the [[Synthesizer V]] engine, which would boost her popularity even further.

Her voice provider is [[Oyamano Mayo]].

Oyamano initially used the name Oyama Nobuyo as a reference to famed singer and voice actress [[Ooyama Nobuyo]]. Since the latter is most known as the voice of [[Doraemon (character)|]], fans had Teto share similar traits. Teto's [[catchphrase]] 君は実に馬鹿だな ("You really are an idiot, aren't you?") also originated from a [[Doraemon]] comic.

Do not tag Kasane Teto as a [[VOCALOID]]. She is either an UTAU or a SynthV.

h4. Official art

* !post #3853931: [[Kasane Teto|UTAU]]

title: hatsune_miku_(nt)
body:
[b]Hatsune Miku NT[/b] (New Type) is the first voicebank for [[Hatsune Miku]] using the [[Piapro Studio]] engine, succeeding her previous voicebank with the [[VOCALOID]] engine, [[hatsune miku (vocaloid4)|Hatsune Miku V4X]].

Continuing from V4X, her design is once again illustrated by [[iXima]], with help from [[rella]].

As before, she has her signature [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[twintails]], white [[sleeveless shirt]] with black [[detached sleeves]], pleated [[miniskirt]], and [[thighhighs]]. Her NT design has been updated with thicker hair, a second layer of inner [[detached sleeves]], and a [[neck ribbon]] instead of necktie. Her hair ornaments are thick and circular like her [[hatsune miku (vocaloid4) (chinese)|V4 Chinese]] design, albeit smaller. Her clothes also have a wave theme.

This voicebank was initially announced in August 2019 along with the fact that Crypton would no longer be collaborating with the [[VOCALOID]] engine and instead using their own in-house engine, Piapro Studio. However, on August 1st, 2024, Crypton announced that they would be returning to the VOCALOID engine with Miku's next voicebank being Hatsune Miku V6 AI. 

h4. Official art

* !post #4187018
* !post #5740267

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: crypton_future_media
body:
A Japanese media company based in Sapporo, Japan that develops and sells products for music. They are best known as the company behind several [[Vocaloid]] products, starting with [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]] and [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]] and later the well-received and popular [i]Character Vocal Series[/i]. They are also responsible for the [[Piapro studio]] synthesizer system, which all of those characters moved to.

h4. List of Crytpon Future Media Characters

* [[MEIKO (vocaloid)|]]
* [[KAITO (vocaloid)|]]
* Character Vocal Series
** [[Hatsune Miku]]
** [[Kagamine Rin]] and [[kagamine len|Len]]
** [[Megurine Luka]]

title: type-moon
body:
Type-Moon is a Japanese media company founded by [[Nasu Kinoko]] and [[Takeuchi Takashi]].

Originally founded as an eroge doujin circle, it's best known for hits like [[tsukihime|Tsukihime]] and [[fate/stay night|Fate/stay night]]. The former was created when Type-Moon was a mere hobbyist group, whereas the latter's success has established the circle into an established gaming and media company.

This tag is applicable when posts featured references to multiple series done by TYPE-MOON, as well as a reference to its staff.

title: kirov_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Soviet light cruiser [i]Kirov[/i]. Character designed by [[Nagu]] and voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

h4. Appearance
Originally revealed in the [i]Northern Overture[/i] event on January 2020, she was made playable in the [i]Khorovod of Dawn's Rime[/i] event in February 2021. By that point, her character design (post #3810553) underwent a slight revision and update (post #4384559).

As drawn by [[Nagu]], she is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] and grayish-[[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[white coat|white]] [[fur-trimmed coat]] over a [[white dress]] that shows her [[cleavage]], a [[black skirt]], [[pantyhose]], and white [[fur-trimmed boots]]. She also wears a white [[papakha]].

Her rig is animalistic in style, like Ironblood, but unpainted and crusted in [[ice]]. Her historical 190 mm triple gun mounts are placed on either side, and noticeable are the [[chain|chains]] wrapped around the rig.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Kirov[/i] was designed with Italian assistance, based off the [[Duca degli Abruzzi (Azur Lane)|Condottieri]]-class light cruisers but enlarged to take in existing 190 mm guns in the Soviet inventory and to provide better protection from the harsher weather conditions.
She was commissioned in 1938 and sold for scrap in 1974.

title: roon_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German heavy cruiser [i]Roon[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[World of Warships]]. 
Character design by [[Terras]], voiced by [[Satou Satomi]]. 

She has [[blonde_hair|blonde hair]] and [[brown_eyes|brown eyes]], with [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]], [[black shirt|black]] [[double-breasted]] [[collared shirt]] with an [[Iron Cross]] medal, [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], and black [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is emblazoned with some white [[Iron Cross]]es and a black-white stripe pattern. It consists of animalistic hull pieces holding her two triple and two twin 203 mm mounts, her intended armament, plus various 105 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s and [[searchlight]]s.

Her looks hide a highly-sinister personality. Similar to [[graf_zeppelin_(azur_lane)|Graf Zeppelin]], Roon is sadistic, relishing in bloodshed against her enemies, and even expresses willingness to attack her own allies. She becomes rather [[yandere]] for the Commander with enough affection, and will eagerly kill anyone who attempts to come between the two. 

Roon has the "Expert Loader" skill, based on the [[World of Warships]] skill of the same name. It allows her to change shell types between high explosive and armor-piercing on the fly.

The historical Roon never saw much in the way of development, and no ship of her class was even considered, ordered, or laid down. The concept was largely based on a triple 8" turret designed by the [i]Kriegsmarine[/i].


h4. Appearance

title: georgia_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the battleship USS [i]Georgia[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Gebijiade 89]], voiced by Shimoji Shino.

h4. Appearance and personality

Georgia is portrayed as a woman with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[large breasts]], [[heterochromia]] ([[yellow eyes|yellow]] on her left and [[blue eyes|blue]] on her right), and a blue-glowing, triangle-shaped feature above her forehead. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[double-breasted]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]], [[black skirt|black]] [[microskirt]], blue [[cloak]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[blue thighhighs|blue thighhigh]] on her left leg, single [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], star [[earrings]], and [[black gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of all three of her planned 457 mm twin mounts, four 127 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], two funnels, and her bridge with its associated [[radar]] set.

Personality-wise, she expresses great pride in her capabilities (not too dissimilar to [[Monarch_(azur_lane)|]]) and a desire to see the world. She also has a craving for Oxy-Cola, a reference to her namesake state housing the bottling plants for [[Coca-Cola]].  She has a rather unique fashion sense as shown in her skins, with unconventional takes on the skin themes.

h4. Info
She represents the original design of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class battleships of the US Navy, equipped with three 457 mm twin mount guns compared to [i]Iowa's[/i] three 406 mm triple guns. The design was abandoned after it was determined that heavier 457 mm shells had no notable performance improvements over the planned Mk8 "Super-Heavy" shells, among other reasons.

As a reference to her [[World of Warships]] counterpart upon which she's based, Georgia receives a skill similar to the "Artillery Plotting Room Modification 2", which provides an improvement to her accuracy. In game, she's a rather high performance if straight forward battleship. And the 18in cannons associated with her is considered the strongest AP ammo gun in the game.

h4. Skins

title: gascogne_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the French battleship [i]Gascogne[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Komatsu Mikako]]. 

She has with [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], wearing a plain [[white dress]] with a black stripe running down the centerline and [[black thighhighs]]. She brandishes a rather large [[cross_(weapon)|cross]] as a melee weapon in addition to her guns. Her personality is robotic, referring to herself in the third-person while constantly verbalizing her actions and status (in addition to those of her allies and the Commander). 

As a reference to [[World of Warships]], from which she was taken as part of the collaboration between Azur Lane and Wargaming, one of her skills boosts her main battery reload.

The historical [i]Gascogne[/i] was a French battleship meant to be a member of the [i]Richelieu[/i]-class, except her main battery was arranged in an A-X layout (similar to [[Admiral Graf Spee (Azur Lane)|]] and her sisters). Before she could be formally ordered, France fell to Nazi Germany and the docks were occupied and looted by occupation forces.

title: drake_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] heavy cruiser HMS [i]Drake[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.
Voiced by [[Imai Asami]].

h4. Appearance

Her physical appearance consists of [[grey_hair|grey hair]] done in a [[ponytail]] framing [[yellow_eyes|gold-colored eyes]]. As with most other cruisers, she also has [[large_breasts|large breasts]], and as a true pirate, has a decent armored [[ass|booty]], emphasized in her skin. Her outfit consists of a white dress framed by a red jacket, and thighhigh boots. She also brandishes a rapier as her melee weapon.

h4. Personality
As her namesake is a historical explorer/privateer, Drake possesses a battle-hungry personality, eager to get into the fight and enjoying herself while stuck in combat. However, like her namesake, she does express a desire to explore, one that grows with her affection.

title: zuikaku_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Zuikaku[/i]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[high ponytail]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[white kimono]] similar to her sister, with [[wide sleeves]] ending in black tips that look like wings of a swan or crane. Her kimono has an attached [[hood]]. She wears a [[red skirt|red]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. Unlike [[Zuikaku (Kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], she has [[large breasts]], which often leads to [[breast envy]] moments in certain fanarts.

Her [[rigging]] is composed of a [[flight deck]] at her right hip as well as a [[katana]] and [[sheath]] that she wields.

She's an energetic, driven girl. She views herself as a rival to [[Enterprise (Azur Lane)|]], pestering her for matches in her lines. She's also very fond of her sister, [[Shoukaku (Azur Lane)|]], mentioning her often in her lines.

title: z23_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s depiction of the German destroyer [i]Z23[/i], lead ship of the 1936A-class. In the game and the fandom, she is often referred to as Nimi in reference to the Iroha order of her number.

In her base art, she wears a [[beret]] with a [[white ribbon]] wrapped around the rim, and a ribbon with an [[iron cross]] on the right side of her head. She has [[short hair|short]], [[brown hair]] with [[blue eyes]]. Her clothes consist of skin-tight under-layer, including [[bike shorts]], with a white [[double-breasted]] piece covering the front part of her body. Around her waist appears to be a combination of a coat and a [[showgirl skirt]], with [[gold trim]], a red inside, and a navy-blue outside. She wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] with heavy duty [[white gloves]] over them. Her [[rigging]] consists of quadruple [[torpedo tubes]] attached to her back, and a handheld twin [[ship turret|turret]] mount housed inside mechanical, shark-like jaws.

title: 3rd_live_tour_try_tri_unity!!!
body:
Posts referring to [[Link! Like! Love Live!|Love Live! Hasu no Sora Jokaguin School Idol Club]] 3rd Live Tour TRY TRI UNITY!!!, a set of live performances held on:

* 2024-11-16: with [[Mira-Cra Park!]],
* 2024-11-24: with [[DOLLCHESTRA]], 
* 2024-12-01: with [[Cerise Bouquet]], 
* 2024-12-21/22: Live & Fan Meeting, and
* 2025-01-10/11: with everyone.

Note that while the last leg is titled "TRI TRI UNITY!!!" (with two TRI's), it is still part of the same live tour, and thus falls under this tag as well.

title: padded_jacket
body:

title: kabuki_kirby
body: A [[copy ability]] exclusive to a special episode of [[Kirby: Right Back at Ya]].

title: water_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]], [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land|its remake]], [[Kirby: Star Allies]], and [[Kirby Fighters 2]] which lets [[Kirby]] use [[water|water-based]] [[attack|attacks]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[gold headwear|gold]] [[diadem]] with [[water]] resting on his head.

title: top_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] exclusive to [[Kirby: Right Back at Ya]] which lets [[Kirby]] throw exploding [[spinning top|spinning tops]].

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[two-sided headwear|and]] [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[backwards hat|backwards]] [[baseball cap]] with a picture of a [[spinning top]] on its center.

title: presentation_gone_wrong_(meme)
body:
A photo of a presentation within a Chinese institution that has seemingly gone awry due to an accidental reveal of the presenter's wallpaper, which features a fanart illustration of [[Shoukaku (azur lane)|]] from [[Azur Lane]].
The illustration ([s]post #3855071[/s]) drawn by [[d._(ddot2018)]] can be viewed by following the links in the External Links section below.

h4. Photo
* !asset #24595602

h4. External links

title: escargon
body: [[King Dedede]]'s [[snail]] servant who appears in the [[kirby: right back at ya|Kirby: Right Back at Ya!]]. Escargon lived in a farm with his mother and sometime ago left home to make her proud and become king, but ended up being a lackey of the King. Siding with the King and often trying to help make his friend's plans work, which often fails, Escargon is just as rude and selfish as Dedede, and takes as much abuse as he dishes out, but deep down he's not so bad. He's also very smart, reading books and even developing machines and stuff.

title: masked_dedede
body: Alter ego of [[King Dedede]], first appearing in [[Kirby Super Star Ultra]]. He wears a grey metal mask witn three yellow horns, and wields a mechanical, hi-tech version of his regular hammer.
